occidualis: <entryFree id="n32091" type="main" key="occi^du^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occiduus</etym>, <sense id="n32091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">western</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occidualis Oceanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 597</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occiduus: <entryFree id="n32092" type="main" key="occi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. occĭdo, I.</etym>. <sense id="n32092.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32092.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Going down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sole jam fere occiduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriens occiduusque dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:832" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:82" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 416</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32092.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">western</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occiduo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:558" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduae primaeque domus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the west and in the east</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:621" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <trans><tr>the evening hour</tr>, <tr>hour of sunset</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduus (sc. sol),</quote> <trans><tr>the west</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 35, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32092.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32092.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">failing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur occiduae per iter declive senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32092.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Frail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsortes animae carnis ab occiduo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 34, 306</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occillator: <entryFree id="n32093" type="gloss" key="occilla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occillātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occillo</etym>, <sense id="n32093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrower</hi>: occillator, <foreign lang="greek">bwloko/pos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
occillo: <entryFree id="n32094" type="hapax" key="occillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>occo</etym>, <sense id="n32094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mi advenienti os occillet probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit> Fleck. (dub.; Ussing, suggillet).</sense></entryFree>
occino: <entryFree id="n32095" type="main" key="occi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭno</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (<sense id="n32095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> occecini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occanui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 38, 4</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-cano</etym>. </sense><sense id="n32095.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chirp inauspiciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to croak</hi>, etc. (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">si occinuerit avis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if by its chirping it gives an unfavorable omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus voce clarā occinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occinentes in eum adversum corvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32095.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia inter se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 349, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occipio: <entryFree id="n32096" type="main" key="occi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi</itype> (coepi), eptum, 3 (<sense id="n32096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> occepso for occepero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occepsit for occeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 49</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ob-capio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi> any thing (not in Cic. <cb n="OCCO" /> or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n32096.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quod occepi, obsonatum pergam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 37</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc quicquid est, quā hoc occeptum est causā, loquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32096.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliam rem occipiat loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere armentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubia vexillum flagitare occipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fabula) occepta est agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32096.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32096.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">a meridie nebula occipiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 6</bibl></cit> Hertz (Weissenb. excepit): <cit><quote lang="la">modo dolores occipiunt primulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventas occipit puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 889</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32096.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in formula, ita ut occepi, in resuming a discourse or topic after an interruption: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut occepi, si animum advortas, dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 43 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
occipitium: <entryFree id="n32097" type="main" key="occi^pi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭpĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ob-caput</etym>, <sense id="n32097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the back part of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the poll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the occiput</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in occipitio quoque habet oculos, pessima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris ad occipitium ductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl>: ne post occipitium exercitus relinqueret, <hi rend="ital">behind his back</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 245, 15</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 107</bibl>.— Prov.: frons occipitio prior est; v. frons; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frontemque domini plus prodesse quam occipitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occiput: <entryFree id="n32098" type="main" key="occi^put"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occĭput</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the back part of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the poll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occiput</hi> (less freq. than occipitium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:62" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 12, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occisio: <entryFree id="n32099" type="main" key="occi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. occīdo</etym>, <sense id="n32099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a massacre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murder</hi> (class. but rare, except in eccl. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">sometimes interchanged in the MSS. with occidio): si caedes et occisio facta non erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 14" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimati sumus sicut oves occisionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 43, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium ad occisionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occisitantur: <entryFree id="n32100" type="main" key="occi_si^tantur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīsĭtantur</orth>, saepe occiduntur: C. Gracchus, in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201</bibl> Müll. [1. occīdo].</entryFree>
occisor: <entryFree id="n32101" type="hapax" key="occi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. occīdo</etym>, <sense id="n32101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occisorius: <entryFree id="n32102" type="main" key="occi_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occisor</etym>, <sense id="n32102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for slaughter</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
occisus: <entryFree id="n32103" type="main" key="occi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. occīdo.</entryFree>
occlamito: <entryFree id="n32104" type="main" key="occla_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occlāmĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obcl-</orth>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>obclamito</etym>, <sense id="n32104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bawl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne occlamites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occlaudo: <entryFree id="n32105" type="main" key="occlaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occlaudo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obcl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. occludo.</entryFree>
occludo: <entryFree id="n32106" type="main" key="occlu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occlūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n32106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync.</hi> form occlusti for occlusisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 151</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">occlaudo</orth>, Cod. Th. 11, 24, 1), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obclaudo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32106.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">FORES OCLVDITO, Lex Puteol. ap. Haubold, p. 72: occlude ostium: et ego hinc occludam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furax servus, cui domi nihil sit nec obsignatum nec occlusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>: ego occlusero fontem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me non excludet ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32106.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>: linguam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to prevent from speaking</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occlusti linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to close</tr>, <tr>shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 628</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to restrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">occlūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obcl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">shut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closed up.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui occlusiorem habeant stultiloquentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>they would keep their foolish talk more to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 185</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium occlusissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit> (dub.; Fleck. oculissumum).</sense></entryFree>
occlusus: <entryFree id="n32107" type="main" key="occlu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occlūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from occludo.</entryFree>
occo: <entryFree id="n32108" type="main" key="occo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root ac, acuo; cf. Germ. eggen, to harrow</etym>, <sense id="n32108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to harrow</hi>: occare et occatorem Verrius dictum putat ab occaedendo, quod caedat grandis globos terrae: cum Cicero venustissime dicat ab occaecando fruges satas, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicia et phasioli occantur tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50</bibl></cit>, <cb n="OCCU" /> § 186.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam semper occant prius quam sarriunt rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>. —Of vineyards, <hi rend="ital">to break up and level</hi> the ground which has been dug up: <cit><quote lang="la">occare, id est comminuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occoeno: <entryFree id="n32109" type="spur" key="occoeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occoeno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a corrupt read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 67</bibl> Müll., for which Müll., by conjecture, obscoena; v. Müll. ad loc.</entryFree>
occoepi: <entryFree id="n32110" type="main" key="occoepi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occoepi</orth>, v. occipio.</entryFree>
occubitus: <entryFree id="n32111" type="main" key="occu^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occumbo</etym>, <sense id="n32111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>, n. 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 28, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 11, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32111.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
occubo: <entryFree id="n32112" type="main" key="occu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-cubo</etym>, <sense id="n32112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> in a place; <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi> in the grave (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad tumulum, quo maximus occubat Hector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paris urbe paternā occubat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelibus occubat umbris,</quote> <trans><tr>reposes with the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebili leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 997" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 997</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul pro vestrā victoriā morte occubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occulco: <entryFree id="n32113" type="main" key="occulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occulco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcalco</etym>. <sense id="n32113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trample down</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene occulcato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cohors) occulcata pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 14, 7</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
occulo: <entryFree id="n32114" type="main" key="occu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>cŭlŭi, cultum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n32114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plup. sync.</hi> occulerat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:280" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 280</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcolo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> (syn.: tego, condo, celo, abdo). </sense><sense id="n32114.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): terra occulit caput, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 141 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta multā terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 346</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to cover up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (class.; esp. in the <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">vitia corporis fuco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(feminae) parietum umbris occuluntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are kept concealed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem in convexo nemorum sub rupe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligine terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncta argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratum ab iis,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep secret</tr>, <tr>conceal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis et imprudens aspexerit, occulat ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n32114.3" n="B" level="2"> Of burying: occultum efferre significat sub terram ferre, ponere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultus</orth> (archaic orthogr. OQVOLTVS, S. C. Bacch.; <cit><quote lang="la">scanned ŏccultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 15</bibl>; cf. Brix, Trin. Einleit. p. 14 Ritschl ad Plaut. Trin. l. l. ed. 2), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. abditus): hi saltem in occultis locis prostant, vos in foro ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res occultae et penitus abditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultiores insidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultior atque tectior cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid erit occultius et reconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res occultissimas aperueris in lucemque protuleris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per occultos calles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit, occulto velut arbor aevo, Fama Marcelli,</quote> <trans><tr>from an obscure</tr>, <tr>remote age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the hidden laws of nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:424" default="NO" valid="yes">424</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 41, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 18 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulti miranda potentia fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.4" n="b" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me astutum et occultum lubet fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occultis cavendum hominibus consultisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultus odii,</quote> <trans><tr>dissembling his hate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Occultus, adverbially for occulte, <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">qui ejusmodi preces occulti illuderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris mei amicitias non occulti ferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32114.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-culta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">secret things</hi> or <hi rend="ital">places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secrets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, quibus occulta creduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui fervens Aestuat occultis animus semperque tacendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta saltuum scrutari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta conjurationis retexere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occultis meis,</quote> <trans><tr>from my secret sins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 18, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">secrecy</hi>, only in adverb. phrases, in occulto; per occultum; ex occulto, <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>: SACRA IN OQVOLTOD NE QVIQVAM FECISE VELET, S. C. Bacch.: in occulto mussabant, Enn. Ann. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 185 Vahl.): <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare in occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: per occultum (post-Aug.), Tac. <pb n="1252" /> <cb n="OCCU" /> A. 6, 7; 4, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 5, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex occulto,</quote> <trans><tr>from a place of concealment</tr>, <tr>secret place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha ex occulto repente nostros invadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex occulto intervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultō</orth> (ante-class.), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultim</orth> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">in concealment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32114.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form occulte: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id occulte fert,</quote> <trans><tr>does not keep it secret</tr>, <tr>makes no secret of it</tr>, <tr>does not conceal it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea nunc occulte cuniculis oppugnatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se constituere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur occulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec clam illud occulteque factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form occulto, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 295 Rib.).— * </sense><sense id="n32114.11" n="(g)" level="5"> Form occultim: <cit><quote lang="la">reptare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32114.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conari occultius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant praeterea complures paulo occultius consilii hujus participes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potuit occultissime reliquas cohortes duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra quam potest occultissime locat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which maxime occulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occultatio: <entryFree id="n32115" type="main" key="occulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. occulto</etym>, <sense id="n32115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealment</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliae fugā se, aliae occultatione tutantur,</quote> <trans><tr>by hiding themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl></cit>: cujus rei nulla est occultatio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in speluncā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 148</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultatione propositā,</quote> <trans><tr>in the expectation of concealment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32115.1" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">insinuation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultatio est, cum dicimus nos praeterire aut non scire aut nolle dicere id, quod nunc maxime dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. the context.</sense></entryFree>
occultator: <entryFree id="n32116" type="main" key="occulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secreter</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille latronum occultator et receptor locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 19, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occulte: <entryFree id="n32117" type="main" key="occulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occultē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">occultim</orth>, <sense id="n32117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. occulo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
occulto: <entryFree id="n32118" type="main" key="occulto_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occultō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. occulo, <sense id="n32118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32119" type="main" key="occulto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occulto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (occultassis for occultaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 1</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>occulo</etym>, <sense id="n32119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secrete</hi> (class.).—With <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque latebrose me abs tuo Conspectu occultabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli avorsari, neque te occultassis mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—The place of concealment usu. expressed by <case>abl.</case> with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aves, tum in hac, tum in illā parte se occultent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hortis suis se occultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (latebrā) tabella occultaret suffragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 11</bibl>; or by <hi rend="ital">advv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi se occultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paucissimis alicubi occultabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—But also by the <case>abl.</case> (of means): <cit><quote lang="la">Hiempsal reperitur, se occultans tugurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulis sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae natura occultavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultare et dissimulare appetitum voluptatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in the contrary order: dissimulare et occultare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus veritas occultetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 85</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Schneider, Nipperdey, Kraner, in terrā): neque occultati humilitate arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 686</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae occultantur,</quote> <trans><tr>hide themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit> (opp. aperiuntur).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est res quaedam, quam occultabam tibi dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occultus: <entryFree id="n32120" type="main" key="occultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from occulo.</entryFree>
occumbo: <entryFree id="n32121" type="main" key="occumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occumbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>cŭbui, cŭbĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-cumbo, cubo</etym>, <sense id="n32121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi> (cf.: occido, obeo, oppeto); hence, </sense><sense id="n32121.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>, of the heavenly bodies (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">cometes cum oriretur occumberetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol occumberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:22:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 22, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32121.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi> dying, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (the class. signif. of the word); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">mortem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morte</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">morti.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32121.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: cum veter occubuit Priamus, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 17 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut occubuissem honeste, aut victores hodie viveremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: pro libertate cos occubuisse, Suet. <cb n="OCCU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa se dimicans occubuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tit. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur et ante annos occubuisse suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederat ne ferro occumbere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32121.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">mortem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morte</hi> (the vacillation of MSS. between these two forms makes it difficult to ascertain which was the prevailing one; cf. Zumpt, Gr. § 387; <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 790): pro patriā mortem (al. morte) occumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 102</bibl></cit> (Kühner, Moser, Orelli, and Baiter have mortem, Klotz and Fischer morte): <cit><quote lang="la">quod liberata patria ... mortem occubuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 25, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pugnantes mortem occubuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 18, 6</bibl></cit>. —So, too, letum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 390 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">necem voluntariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit> (al., with inferior MSS., nece voluntariā): <cit><quote lang="la">ictus clavā morte occubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">morte occumbentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo pro republicā morte occubuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32121.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">morti</hi> (perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): pro vostrā vitā morti occumbant obviam. Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 62</bibl> (Trag. v. 176 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">certae morti, Verg. A. l. l.: neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 499</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32121.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To succumb to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall by the hand of one</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>).—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rullo ditissimus agri Occumbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 74</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per te vidit Vulcani occumbere prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 437</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n32121.7" n="III" level="1"> Like accumbere, <hi rend="ital">to lie at table</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occupaticius: <entryFree id="n32122" type="gloss" key="occu^pa_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpātīcĭus</orth> <itype>ager dicitur, qui desertus a cultoribus propriis, ab aliis occupatur</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 180 and 181 Müll.; cf. occupatorius.</entryFree>
occupatio: <entryFree id="n32123" type="main" key="occu^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occupo</etym>, <sense id="n32123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking possession of</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">a seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupying</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32123.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <trans><tr>a taking possession</tr>, <tr>seizure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32123.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32123.3" n="A" level="2"> Rhet. t. t.: ante occupatio, <hi rend="ital">an anticipation</hi> of an opponent's objections, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl> (but in <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl>, the true reading is occultatio, q. v.).—</sense><sense id="n32123.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi> (the usual meaning, esp. of public service; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">studium): in maximis occupationibus tuis numquam intermittis studia doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximis occupationibus distinebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis occupationibus inplicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille aut occupatione aut difficultate tardior tibi erit visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni occupatione se expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relaxare se occupatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque has tantularum rerum occupationes sibi Britanniae anteponendas judicabat,</quote> <trans><tr>engaging in such trivial affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occupatorius: <entryFree id="n32124" type="main" key="occu^pa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has been taken possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">already in possession</hi>: ager, Sicul. Fl. p. 3 Goes. al.; cf. occupaticius.</sense></entryFree>
occupatus: <entryFree id="n32125" type="main" key="occu^pa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from occupo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32126" type="main" key="occu^pa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occupo</etym>, <sense id="n32126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi> (post-class.), Claud. Mamert. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: post magni Alexandri occupatus, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occupo: <entryFree id="n32127" type="main" key="occu^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occŭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (occupassis for occupaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 48</bibl>: <sense id="n32127.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">occupassit for occupaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obcapio; lit., to lay hold of; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi> any thing (esp. a place; class.; cf.: expugno, obsideo). </sense><sense id="n32127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Italiam suis praesidiis obsidere atque occupare cogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go in</tr>, <tr>enter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam optimam occupavit,</quote> <trans><tr>has got hold of</tr>, <tr>has got into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupando adquirere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:66" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 66</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 2:215" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 215</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia occupabit sementem,</quote> <trans><tr>shall reach to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amplexu,</quote> <trans><tr>to clasp in one's arms</tr>, <tr>to embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:509" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 509</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32127.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32127.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To occupy</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">atrā nube polum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem (sc. aedificiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementis Tyrrhenum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32127.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> one with any thing (syn. invado): <cit><quote lang="la">Latagum saxo ... Occupat os faciemque adversam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem gladio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="OCCU" /> 82 (5, 4, 84): <cit><quote lang="la">ne occupet te pluvia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 18. 44</bibl></cit>: caligo, id. Job, 3, 5.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a friendly sense, <hi rend="ital">to surprise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volteium Philippus Vilia vendentem Occupat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32127.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get the start of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be beforehand with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to outstrip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat egressas quamlibet ante rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo, tu prior ut occupes adire,</quote> <trans><tr>that you should present yourself the first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin the war first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapere oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32127.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32127.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engross</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus timor omnem exercitum occupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor occupat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor occupat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos magnitudine rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 499</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32127.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>: haec causa primos menses occupabit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in mentem venit tres et sexaginta annos aeque multa volumina occupasse mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in funambulo Animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contio, quae homines occupatos occupat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta superstitio mentis Siculorum occupavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 113</bibl></cit>: pecuniam, <hi rend="ital">to put out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay out money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam adulescentulo grandi fenore occupavisti,</quote> <trans><tr>have loaned it at a high rate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias apud populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam animalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay out</tr>, <tr>invest in cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in pecore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante occupatur animus ab iracundiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-cŭpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">taken up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut si occupati profuimus aliquid civibus nostris, prosimus etiam otiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in patriā delendā occupati et sunt et fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostibus opere occupatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">married</hi>, occupatae (opp. to vacuae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 376" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 376</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: comitiorum dilationes occupatiorem me habebant, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubito, quin occupatissimus fueris,</quote> <trans><tr>very much occupied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 21, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occurro: <entryFree id="n32128" type="main" key="occurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-curro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obc-</orth>), <itype>curri, rarely cucurri</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>), cursum, 3 (archaic <sense id="n32128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> occecurri, like memordi, peposci, Aelius Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 11</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to run up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run to meet; to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> (class.; syn. obvenio). </sense><sense id="n32128.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32128.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico Occucurri atque interpello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari venienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurritur (sc. mihi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> an enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus Fabianis legionibus occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis occurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvius adversoque occurrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 734</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32128.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall in with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscumque signis occurrerat, se aggregabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot vatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to</hi> any place. </sense><sense id="n32128.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32128.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati ad id concilium occurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliam civitatem occurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:27:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 27, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.10" n="3" level="3"> Of situation. </sense><sense id="n32128.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie opposite to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Elegiam occurrit ei (Euphrati) Taurus mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To lie in the way of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi> as an obstacle: <cit><quote lang="la">in asperis locis silex saepe impenetrabilis ferro occurrebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32128.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To obviate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seek to obviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counteract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ejus consiliis occurri atque obstiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: malevolentiae hominum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attempt to cure; to relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venienti occurrite morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:64" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei sapientiā occurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To meet with words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si dicenti, Quem video? ita occurras, ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:222" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 222</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurretur enim, sicut occursum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: occurritur autem nobis, et quidem a doctis et <pb n="1253" /> <cb n="OCCU" /> eruditis, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.17" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">present itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggest itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu occurrebas dignus eo munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen mihi quicquam occurrit cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium classis demersae et exercitus deleti occurrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea cum universa occurrerent animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:12:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 24, 12, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis ejus tot paludes occurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras ad Eurum sequentibus nihil memorabile occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <trans><tr>presents itself to his mind</tr>, <tr>occurs to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae occurrant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una defensio occurrit, quod muneribus tuis obniti non debui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationi, quonam modo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vos paeon, aut herous ille conturbet: ipsi occurrent orationi,</quote> <trans><tr>will present themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tenenda sunt oratori: saepe enim occurrunt,</quote> <trans><tr>often occur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque in mentem veniat, aut quodcumque occurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid honestum occurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrit et aliqua dicere de magicis (herbis),</quote> <trans><tr>it seems proper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 99, § 156</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32128.18" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">donec occurramus in unitatem fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo modo occurram ad resurrectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
