occursaculum: <entryFree id="n32129" type="hapax" key="occursa_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>occurso</etym>, <sense id="n32129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which meets</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appears to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctium occursacula,</quote> <trans><tr>nocturnal apparitions</tr>, <tr>ghosts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occursatio: <entryFree id="n32130" type="main" key="occursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running to meet one</hi>, out of respect or for the sake of courting favor; <hi rend="ital">attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">officiousness</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">facilis est illa occursatio et blanditia popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestras et vestrorum ordinum occursationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occursator: <entryFree id="n32131" type="main" key="occursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs up to others</hi> to salute them, or to secure their favor; <hi rend="ital">an attentive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">officious person</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occursatrix: <entryFree id="n32132" type="main" key="occursa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occursator</etym>, <sense id="n32132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that runs up to one</hi>: artificum, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. spintyrnix, p. 333, 1 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
occursio: <entryFree id="n32133" type="main" key="occursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>occurro</etym>, <sense id="n32133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a visit</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">a fraternis occursionibus (al. occursibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18, 2</bibl></cit> Grut. (Haase, occursibus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occursito: <entryFree id="n32134" type="main" key="occursi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n32134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [occurso], <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occurso: <entryFree id="n32135" type="main" key="occurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occurso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n32135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [occurro], <hi rend="ital">to run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">come to meet; to meet</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n32135.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32135.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alios occursantes interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursare capro ... caveto,</quote> <trans><tr>beware of meeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: occursantes inter se radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32135.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32135.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rush against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge; to strive against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursat ocius gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter invidos, occursantes, factiosos,</quote> <trans><tr>opposing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimus quisque et promptissimus ad occursandum pugnandumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32135.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu huc occursas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32135.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32135.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be beforehand with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32135.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appear before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present one's self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32135.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to appear to the mind; to suggest itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter the thoughts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur to</hi> one; with or without <hi rend="ital">animo;</hi> also with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursant animo scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursant verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me occursant multae, meminisse hau possum,</quote> <trans><tr>occur to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occursor: <entryFree id="n32136" type="main" key="occursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Music. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Music. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
occursorius: <entryFree id="n32137" type="main" key="occurso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>occursor</etym>, <sense id="n32137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to meeting</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">occursoria potio,</quote> <trans><tr>a draught taken before a meal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 227, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
occursus: <entryFree id="n32138" type="main" key="occursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">occursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>occurro</etym>, <sense id="n32138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling in with</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: obviam itio, occursatio, etc.): vacuis occursu hominum viis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the streets</tr>, <tr>where they met nobody</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohiberi fratrum ejus occursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:29" default="NO">6, 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursum alicujus vitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to avoid meeting him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: in occursum ejus, <cb n="OCEL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in occursum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">rota stipitis occursu fracta ac disjecta,</quote> <trans><tr>by coming in contact with a stump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbis nocturnam lunae successionem a fraternis occursibus lene remissumque lumen mutuantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18, 2</bibl></cit> Haase (al. occursionibus): <cit><quote lang="la">occursum trepidare amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis occursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:418" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 418</bibl></cit>.—Of the Labyrinth: <cit><quote lang="la">occursus ac recursus inexplicabiles,</quote> <trans><tr>approaches and withdrawals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oce: <entryFree id="n32139" type="main" key="oce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ocē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of little bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swallow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 257</bibl>; v. Sillig, ad h. l. (al. orcen, oten).</sense></entryFree>
oceanensis: <entryFree id="n32140" type="main" key="O_ce^a^nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Oceanus, II. A.</entryFree>
oceaneolus: <entryFree id="n32141" type="gloss" key="O_ce^a^ne^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 882, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oceanitis: <entryFree id="n32142" type="main" key="O_ce^a^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Oceanus, II. B.</entryFree>
oceanus: <entryFree id="n32143" type="main" key="O_ce^a^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)wkeano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the great sea that encompasses the land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ocean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis terra parva quaedam insula est, circumfusa illo mari, quod Atlanticum, quod magnum, quem Oceanum appellatis in terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: Oceanum rubra obruit aethra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. p. 418 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani freta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Strait of Gades</tr>, <tr>Strait of Gibraltar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt maritimae civitates Oceanumque attingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvagus,</quote> <trans><tr>circumfluent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:41" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissociabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 32</bibl></cit>.—The form <itype>Oceanum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, is found only in apposition with mare: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (insulam) mare Oceanum circumluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus mare Oceanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in nostrum et Oceanum mare extendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari Oceano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari Oceano aut amnibus longinquis saeptum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—(Supposed examples of the adjectival use of Oceanus, as Oceano fluctu and litore, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 94</bibl> and 113 Jan; Oceanas aquas, Ven. Carm. 3, 9, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 7:12:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 12, 56</bibl></cit>, are dub.; several edd. read in Juv., Oceani; and in Ven., in the first passage, Oceanus, and in the second, Oceani.)—</sense><sense id="n32143.1" n="2" level="3"> Personified, as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Cœlus and Terra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Tethys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the father of the rivers and nymphs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:88:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 88, 6</bibl>.—The ancient philosophers regard water as the primary element of all things; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: Oceanumque patrem rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 382</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32143.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32143.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A large bathing-tub</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 25, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32143.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:95:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 95, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:27:4" default="NO">5, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:9:2" default="NO">6, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1453</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32143.5" n="II" level="1"> Hence, ‡ </sense><sense id="n32143.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the ocean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated by the sea-side</hi>, Eckhel. D. N. 8, p. 110.—</sense><sense id="n32143.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Ocean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clioque et Beroe soror, Oceanitides ambae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 341</bibl></cit>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
ocelis: <entryFree id="n32144" type="main" key="O_ce_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/wkhlis</foreign>, <sense id="n32144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the Arabian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocella: <entryFree id="n32145" type="main" key="O^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏcella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ocellus, small-eyed</etym>, <sense id="n32145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 431, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocellatus: <entryFree id="n32146" type="main" key="o^cella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ocellus</etym>, <sense id="n32146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having little eyes</hi> (ante class. and post-Aug.).—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcellātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a small stone marked with eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spots</hi>: altera exorat patrem libram ocellatorum (<hi rend="ital">like dice</hi>), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 213, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocellatis ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit> (also v. l. for oculatae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
ocellina: <entryFree id="n32147" type="main" key="O^celli_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏcellīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Ocella</etym>, <sense id="n32147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livia Ocellina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocellulus: <entryFree id="n32148" type="gloss" key="o^cellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcellŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ocellus</etym>, <sense id="n32148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little eye</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
ocellus: <entryFree id="n32149" type="main" key="o^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>oculus</etym>, <sense id="n32149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eyelet</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n32149.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda quies furtim vietis obrepsit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ocellis hilaritudo est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgiduli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acre malum semper stillantis ocelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prurit frictus ocelli angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:578" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 578</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelle mi!</quote> <trans><tr>my little eye! my darling!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: jucundissimus meus, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave despuas, ocelle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50</bibl></cit>, <cb n="OCQU" /> 19.—So of things, like our <hi rend="ital">apple of the eye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ocellos Italiae, villulas meas, non vides?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32149.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bulb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knob</hi> on the roots of the reed (called also oculus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocelum: <entryFree id="n32150" type="main" key="O_ce^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcĕlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/wkelon</foreign>, <sense id="n32150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Gallia Cisalpina</hi>, now perh. <hi rend="ital">Usselio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ochani: <entryFree id="n32151" type="main" key="Ocha_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ochāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the shores of the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 47</bibl> (Jahn, Orciani).</sense></entryFree>
ochra: <entryFree id="n32152" type="greek" key="o_chra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōchra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)/xra</foreign>, <sense id="n32152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ochre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yellow ochre</hi>, a kind of earth that yields a yellow color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ochus: <entryFree id="n32153" type="main" key="O_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=wxos</foreign>. <sense id="n32153.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Bactriana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that empties into the Oxus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32153.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Artaxerxes III.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Persia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32153.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Darius Codomannus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocimoides: <entryFree id="n32154" type="greek" key="o_ci^mo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭmŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)kimoeide/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ocimum-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the ocimum kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carduum silvaticum alii ocimoides vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocimum: <entryFree id="n32155" type="greek" key="o_ci^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)/kimon</foreign>, <sense id="n32155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">basil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:119" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 12, 48, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:319" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 319</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocinum: <entryFree id="n32156" type="greek" key="o_ci^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭnum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭmum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ōcymum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōzymum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)/kinon</foreign>, <sense id="n32156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb which serves for fodder</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a sort of clover</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:143" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 16, 42, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocior: <entryFree id="n32157" type="main" key="o_ci^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭor</orth>, <itype>ōcĭus</itype> (<sense id="n32157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> ocissimus), <hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi> [kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)ku/s</foreign>, Sanscr. ācu, from the root ac, sharp; cf.: acer, acutus, <foreign lang="greek">a)kwkh/</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">swifter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n32157.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ventis, et fulminis ocior alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocior cervis, Ocior Euro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 20, 13: fugit ocior aurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris ocior remeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 25, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ociore ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ociore spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 17, § 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32157.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">quicker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier; sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficorum ocissima senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans><tr>the soonest ripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcĭ-ter</orth>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> ōcĭus; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> ocissĭme (old collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">oxime</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=195" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 195</bibl> Müll.); <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi> (class. only in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.;</hi> cf.: ocius secundae collationis et deinde tertiae ocissime frequentata sunt, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.). </sense><sense id="n32157.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): ociter serva cives, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 21</bibl>, acc. to Vahl. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 1" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profer ociter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 32</bibl></cit>; p. 125, 8.—</sense><sense id="n32157.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">idque ocius faciet, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ocius ad tuum pervenias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreantur ocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: omnium Versatur urna, serius ocius Sors exitura, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">later</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus iste feret piper et tus ocius uvā,</quote> <trans><tr>sooner than</tr>, <tr>rather than</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocius illud extorquebis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>more easily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32157.5" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> is used in gen. for <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere hac me ocius, Ter Heaut. 4, 7, 4: gladio occursat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemon' oleum fert ocius?</quote> <trans><tr>quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:252" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 828</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus Phaedrome, exi, exi, exi, inquam, ocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32157.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>: ocissime nos liberi possumus fieri, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ocissume ad provinciam accedat,</quote> <trans><tr>as speedily as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanant ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocliferius: <entryFree id="n32158" type="main" key="ocli^fe^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oclĭfĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (oculus-ferio), <sense id="n32158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striking the eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">thrust into prominence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocnus: <entryFree id="n32159" type="main" key="Ocnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/oknos</foreign> (sloth). <sense id="n32159.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The founder of the city of Mantua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 198</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32159.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An allegorical picture of Socrales the painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which represented a man twisting a rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while an ass kept gnawing it apart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl>.—Hence, prov., of labor in vain, which never comes to an end, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:3:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocquinisco: <entryFree id="n32160" type="hapax" key="ocquinisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oc-quinisco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">obqu-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">oquin-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n32160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [quino, kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">kine/w</foreign>; cf. conquinisco], <hi rend="ital">to bend down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stoop</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 22 sq.</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 126 and 149 Rib.) <pb n="1254" /> <cb n="OCTA" /></sense></entryFree>
ocrea: <entryFree id="n32161" type="main" key="o_^cre^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ō^crĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">o)/kris</foreign>, a prominence</etym>, <sense id="n32161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">x greave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leggin</hi> (made of mixed metal, and used to protect the legs of foot-soldiers, and also of hunters and country people; <cit><quote lang="la">it was sometimes worn only on one leg): ocrea, quod opponebatur ob crus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl></cit> Müll.: ocrem montem confragosum dicebant antiqui. Hinc ocreae dictae inaequaliter tuberatae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=180" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 180</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ocreas et cristas invenere Cares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 634</bibl></cit>. —The Samnites wore a greave only on the left leg: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistrum crus ocreā tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:419" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 419</bibl>).—Worn by heavy-armed Romans on the right leg, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>.— Worn by hunters; <cit><quote lang="la">v. ocreatus.—By rustics,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocreas vendente puellā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>parting with the attire of a gladiator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:258" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32162" type="main" key="Ocre^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocrĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Luscius Ocrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocreatus: <entryFree id="n32163" type="main" key="o_^cre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ō^crĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. ocrea</etym>, <sense id="n32163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greaved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nive Lucanā dormis ocreatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 7, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocresia: <entryFree id="n32164" type="main" key="O^cre_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏcrēsĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ŏcrīsĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female slave of Tanaquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of king Servius Tullius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:627" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 627</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 70, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 7, 1</bibl>.—Form Ocrisia <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocriculum: <entryFree id="n32165" type="main" key="Ocri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Umbria</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Otricoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32165.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocrĭcŭ-lānus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocrĭcŏlānus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Otrĭ-cŭlānus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ocriculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ocriculan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ocriculana villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl></cit>.—The tribus OCRIC., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 189, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">194, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1031, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 16</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ocrĭcŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ocriculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Ocriculans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocris: <entryFree id="n32166" type="greek" key="ocris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ocris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/kris</foreign> [akin to acer, ocior, root ac-], <sense id="n32166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stony mountain</hi> (ante-class.): ocrem antiqui montem confragosum vocabant, ut apud Livium: qui ascendunt altum ocrim; et, celsosque ocrīs arvaque petria; et, namque Taenari celsos ocrīs; et, in Pelio ocri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ocrisia: <entryFree id="n32167" type="main" key="O^cri_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏcrīsĭa</orth>, v. Ocresia.</entryFree>
octachordos: <entryFree id="n32168" type="greek" key="octa^chordos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăchordos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">octochordos</orth>), <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/xordos</foreign>, <sense id="n32168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight-stringed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octachord</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octachorus: <entryFree id="n32169" type="greek" key="octa^cho_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăchōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/xwros</foreign>, <sense id="n32169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having four sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrangular</hi>: templum, Ambros. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1166, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octaedros: <entryFree id="n32170" type="greek" key="octa^e_^dros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăē^dros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/edros</foreign>, <sense id="n32170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight-sided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octahedron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, 233</bibl> (as Greek, Kopp. § 722).</sense></entryFree>
octaeteris: <entryFree id="n32171" type="greek" key="octa^e^te_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăĕtēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktaethri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of eight years</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
octagonos: <entryFree id="n32172" type="main" key="octa^go_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăgōnos</orth>, v. octogonos.</entryFree>
octameter: <entryFree id="n32173" type="greek" key="octa^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octămĕter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/metros</foreign>, <sense id="n32173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having eight feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octameter;</hi> in prosody, Mar. Vict. p. 2528 P.</sense></entryFree>
octangulus: <entryFree id="n32174" type="main" key="octangu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n32174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octangular</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">octangula sphaera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octans: <entryFree id="n32175" type="main" key="octans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>octo</etym>, a measuring instrument, <sense id="n32175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half quadrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an octant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octanus: <entryFree id="n32176" type="main" key="Octa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier of the eighth legion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1354</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
octaphoron: <entryFree id="n32177" type="main" key="octa^pho^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăphŏron</orth>, v. octophoron.</entryFree>
octas: <entryFree id="n32178" type="greek" key="octas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number eight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 740</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octasemus: <entryFree id="n32179" type="greek" key="octa^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octăsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/shmos</foreign>, t. t. of the metrical art, <sense id="n32179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing eight times</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 985</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octastylos: <entryFree id="n32180" type="greek" key="octa^sty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octă-stȳlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n32180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having eight columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octostyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octateuchus: <entryFree id="n32181" type="greek" key="octa^teuchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octă-teuchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)kta/teuxos</foreign>, <sense id="n32181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in eight volumes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octateuch</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">primus scripturarum divinarum codex est octateuchus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octavani: <entryFree id="n32182" type="main" key="Octa_va_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octāvāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>octavus</etym>, <sense id="n32182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the eighth legion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Octavanorum colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octavarius: <entryFree id="n32183" type="main" key="octa_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octāvārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the eighth part</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <trans><tr>a tax of the eighth part</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 4, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32183.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octāvārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a receiver of this tax</hi>: octavarii vectigal accipiant, Cod. Th. 4, 12, 8; cf. octavus, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
octavius: <entryFree id="n32184" type="main" key="Octa_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octāvĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octāvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1 sq.</bibl>; cf. Drumann, History of Rome, vol. iv. p. 218 sq. </sense><sense id="n32184.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Octavius, <hi rend="ital">the father of the</hi> <cb n="OCTO" /> <hi rend="ital">emperor Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.2" n="2" level="3"> Cn. Octavius, <hi rend="ital">the first consul of this</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.3" n="3" level="3"> M. Octavius Caecina, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.4" n="4" level="3"> Rarely of <hi rend="ital">the emperor Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:242" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.5" n="5" level="3"> In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Octavia, <hi rend="ital">the name of the two sisters of the emperor Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.6" n="6" level="3"> Octavia was also the name of <hi rend="ital">the daughter of the emperor Claudius and Messalina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32184.7" n="7" level="3"> Octaviae Porticus, <hi rend="ital">two halls in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1" default="NO">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32184.8" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an Octavius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Octavian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Octaviano bello,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the war of the consul Cn. Octavius with Cinna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <trans><tr>of M. Octavius</tr>, <tr>who fought for Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octāvĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was adopted out of the</hi> gens Octavia <hi rend="ital">into the</hi> gens Julia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 79:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 79, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octavus: <entryFree id="n32185" type="main" key="octa_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octāvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo</etym>, <sense id="n32185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eighth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octava pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <trans><tr>the eighth mile-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 65, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32185.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octāva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n32185.2" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. hora.) <hi rend="ital">The eighth hour of the day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32185.3" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. pars.) <hi rend="ital">The eighth part</hi>, as a tax, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 65, 7</bibl>; Cod. Th. 4, 12, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 12</bibl> (cf. octavarius).—</sense><sense id="n32185.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octāvum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the eighth time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octavusdecimus: <entryFree id="n32186" type="main" key="octa_vusde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octāvus-dĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eighteenth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octennis: <entryFree id="n32187" type="main" key="octennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo-annus</etym>, <sense id="n32187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight years old</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octennium: <entryFree id="n32188" type="main" key="octenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (octo-annus), <sense id="n32188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of eight years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertio quoque octennio,</quote> <trans><tr>every twenty-four years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octies: <entryFree id="n32189" type="main" key="octi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octĭes</orth> or <sense id="n32189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">octiens,</hi> <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>octo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">eight times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septenos octies anfractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octigesimus: <entryFree id="n32190" type="main" key="octi^ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octĭgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. octingentesimus.</entryFree>
octingenarius: <entryFree id="n32191" type="main" key="octinge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octingēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octingeni</etym>, <sense id="n32191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of eight hundred</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1355</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
octingeni: <entryFree id="n32192" type="gloss" key="octinge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octingēni</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">octingentēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n32192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distr. num. adj.</hi> [octo-centum], <hi rend="ital">a hundred each</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1353</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
octingentesimus: <entryFree id="n32193" type="main" key="octingente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octingentēsĭmus</orth> (<sense id="n32193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync.</hi> octigesimus, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1353</bibl> P.), a, um, <hi rend="ital">ord. num. adj.</hi> [octingenti], <hi rend="ital">the eight hundredth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octingenti: <entryFree id="n32194" type="main" key="octingenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octingenti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n32194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> octingentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21, 4</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">card. num. adj.</hi> [octocentum], <hi rend="ital">eight hundred</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Planc 25, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stadia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octingenties: <entryFree id="n32195" type="main" key="octingenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octingentĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tiens</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>octingenti</etym>, <sense id="n32195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight hundred times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium bis mille octingenties,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 610</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octipes: <entryFree id="n32196" type="main" key="octi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo-pes</etym>, <sense id="n32196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eightfooted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Cancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 150; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:313" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 313</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octiplicatus: <entryFree id="n32197" type="main" key="octipli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octiplĭcātus</orth>, v. octuplicatus.</entryFree>
octo: <entryFree id="n32198" type="main" key="octo^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŏ</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)ktw/</foreign>; Sanscr. ashtan; Goth. ahtau; Germ. acht; Engl. eight</etym>, <sense id="n32198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight</hi>: milia militum octo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 556</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 336 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">milia passuum octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum et octo anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 229</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octoas: <entryFree id="n32199" type="main" key="octo^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŏăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>octo</etym>, = octas, <sense id="n32199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number eight</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
october: <entryFree id="n32200" type="main" key="Octo_ber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octōber</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the eighth</hi> (month), <hi rend="ital">the eighth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">October</hi>, originally the eighth month of the Roman year, reckoning from March; <cit><quote lang="la">usually connected with mensis: mense Octobri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Octobres Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:67:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 87, 1</bibl></cit>: October equus appellatur, qui in campo Martio mense Octobri immolatur quot annis Marti, bigarum victricum dexterior, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octōber</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">October</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32201" type="gloss" key="October2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">October</orth>, <sense id="n32201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arval. p. 564.</sense></entryFree>
octochordos: <entryFree id="n32202" type="main" key="octo^chordos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŏchordos</orth>, v. octachordos.</entryFree>
octodecim: <entryFree id="n32203" type="main" key="octo_de^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōdĕcim</orth>, <sense id="n32203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">card. num. adj.</hi> [octo-decem], <hi rend="ital">eighteen</hi> (mostly post-class, for duodeviginti):<cb n="OCTU" />  tetrachma Attica centum octodecim milia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:37" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octodurus: <entryFree id="n32204" type="main" key="Octo_du_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octōdūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Veragri</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, the modern <hi rend="ital">Martigny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32204.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octō-dūrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Octodurus;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octōdūrenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Octodurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Octodurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octogamus: <entryFree id="n32205" type="greek" key="octo_ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktw/-ga/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n32205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has been married eight times</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 1</bibl>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
octogenarius: <entryFree id="n32206" type="main" key="octo_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octogeni</etym>, <sense id="n32206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing eighty</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">exheredata ab octogenario patre,</quote> <trans><tr>who was a man of eighty</tr>, <tr>was eighty years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:19:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 19, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>eighty inches broad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32206.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgē-nārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a commander of eighty soldiers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3628</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octogeni: <entryFree id="n32207" type="main" key="octo_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n32207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> octogenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 58" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 58</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [octo], <hi rend="ital">eighty each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">data ex praedā militibus aeris octogeni bini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32207.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">eighty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 75, § 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octogesa: <entryFree id="n32208" type="main" key="Octoge_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octogēsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Iberus</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">La Granja</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octogesimus: <entryFree id="n32209" type="main" key="octo_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [octoginta], <hi rend="ital">the eightieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum annum ago et octogesimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octogies: <entryFree id="n32210" type="main" key="octo_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-iens</orth>, <sense id="n32210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">eighty times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium centies et octogies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octoginta: <entryFree id="n32211" type="main" key="octo_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōginta</orth> (octuaginta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 17</bibl>), <sense id="n32211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. card. adj.</hi> [octo], <hi rend="ital">eighty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui octoginta regnaverat annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octogonos: <entryFree id="n32212" type="greek" key="octo_go_no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgōnŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">octāgōnŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktw/-gwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octagonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris marmorea octogonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octōgōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an octagon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
octojugis: <entryFree id="n32213" type="main" key="octoju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octojŭgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n32213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight in a team</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eight together</hi>, transf., in gen., for <hi rend="ital">eight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc jam octojuges ad imperia obtinenda ire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eight military tribunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32213.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">one of the œons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octolophus: <entryFree id="n32214" type="main" key="Octolophus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Octolophus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Octolophum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 40, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octominutalis: <entryFree id="n32215" type="main" key="octo_mi^nu_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octō-mĭnūtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worth eight farthings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eight coppers</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">libra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 22, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
octonalis: <entryFree id="n32216" type="main" key="octo_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo</etym>, <sense id="n32216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight</hi> (late Lat.), Adaman Locc. Sanct. 1, 22.</sense></entryFree>
octonarius: <entryFree id="n32217" type="main" key="octo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octoni</etym>, <sense id="n32217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of eight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 86</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>an Iambic verse of eight feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 514</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>the plate for which was eight inches broad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 28" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:42" default="NO">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octoni: <entryFree id="n32218" type="main" key="octo_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n32218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [octo]. </sense><sense id="n32218.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Eight each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eight at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by eights</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii octonos lapides ecfodiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 30</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus generis octoni ordines ducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat Bellovacis decem, octona Pictonibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octona milia peditum praetoribus data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32218.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">eight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octonis iterum natalibus actis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 50</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: octonus (late Lat.) numerus, <hi rend="ital">the number eight</hi>, Hil. prol. in Psa. 14.</sense></entryFree>
octonus: <entryFree id="n32219" type="main" key="octo_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōnus</orth>, v. octoni <sense id="n32219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
octophoron: <entryFree id="n32220" type="greek" key="octo_pho^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōphŏron</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">octăph-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktw)foron</foreign>, <sense id="n32220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a litter carried by eight bearers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem portare octophoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:84:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 84, 1</bibl>.—Apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā octophoro ferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 6 (2d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
octosyllabus: <entryFree id="n32221" type="main" key="octo_sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>octo-syllaba</etym>, <sense id="n32221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having eight syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octosyllabic</hi> (postclass.), Mar. Vict. p. 2598 P.</sense></entryFree>
octotopi: <entryFree id="n32222" type="greek" key="octo_to^pi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octōtŏpi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktw\ to/poi</foreign>, in astrology, <sense id="n32222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight places in the heavens.</hi> between the four cardinal points, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 968</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octovir: <entryFree id="n32223" type="gloss" key="octovir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octo-vir</orth>, <itype>ĭri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a member of a council of eight</hi> (usually written VIII VIR), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3658</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3699</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3963</bibl>; 3966.</sense></entryFree>
octuaginta: <entryFree id="n32224" type="main" key="octu^a_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŭāginta</orth>, v. octoginta.</entryFree>
octuplicatio: <entryFree id="n32225" type="main" key="octu^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŭplĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>octuplicatus</etym> <pb n="1255" /> <cb n="OCUL" /> <sense id="n32225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making eightfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a multiplying by eight</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 796</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
octuplicatus: <entryFree id="n32226" type="hapax" key="octu^pli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŭplĭcātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">octĭplĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [octuplus], <sense id="n32226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made eightfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multiplied by eight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octupled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octuplicato censu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
