octuplus: <entryFree id="n32227" type="greek" key="octu^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octŭplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ktaplou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n32227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eightfold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">octuple</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">octŭplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the eightfold penalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the octuple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnare aliquem octupli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena octupli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium in octuplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
octussis: <entryFree id="n32228" type="main" key="octussis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">octussis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>octo-as</etym>, <sense id="n32228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eight asses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quanti emptae? Parvo. Quanti ergo? Octussibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 156</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 58</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
oculariarius: <entryFree id="n32229" type="gloss" key="o^cu^la_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ocularis</etym>, <sense id="n32229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye-</hi>: FABER OCVLARIARIVS, <hi rend="ital">who inserted artificial eyes</hi> (of glass, silver, etc.) <hi rend="ital">in statues</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 645, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocularis: <entryFree id="n32230" type="main" key="o^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oculus</etym>, <sense id="n32230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ocularis medicus,</quote> <trans><tr>an eye-doctor</tr>, <tr>oculist</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32230.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a medicament for the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye-salve</hi>, Pelag. Vet. 30.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ocularly</hi> (post class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculariter intueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 14</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
ocularius: <entryFree id="n32231" type="main" key="o^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CHIRVRGVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 400, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritas,</quote> <trans><tr>of the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudo,</quote> <trans><tr>a disease of the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocularius medicus,</quote> <trans><tr>an oculist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an oculist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oculata: <entryFree id="n32232" type="main" key="o^cu^la_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oculatus</etym>, <sense id="n32232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a lamprey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oculatus: <entryFree id="n32233" type="main" key="o^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oculus</etym>. <sense id="n32233.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluris est oculatus testis unus quam auriti decem,</quote> <trans><tr>an eye-witness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inspectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius male oculatus,</quote> <trans><tr>whose sight was bad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duobus luminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: aedis patulis oculata fenestris, Ven. Fort. Carm. 3, 7, 47.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculatior deus,</quote> <trans><tr>that has better sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32233.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">eye-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculati circuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32233.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Ornamented with stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">starred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32233.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That strikes the eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposed to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>: ne <foreign lang="greek">baqu/ths</foreign> mea in scribendo sit oculatior (al. occultior), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 3</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: oculatissimus locus, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 24</bibl>: oculatā die vendere, <hi rend="ital">to sell on a visible pay-day</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for cash</hi> (opp. caecā die), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oculeus: <entryFree id="n32234" type="main" key="o^cu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of eyes</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n32234.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32234.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sharpsighted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculeus totus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 810</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oculicrepida: <entryFree id="n32235" type="spur" key="o^cu^licre^pi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭli-crĕpĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, a false read. for collicrepidae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 14</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
oculissimus: <entryFree id="n32236" type="main" key="o^cu^lissi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlissĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a comically formed <sense id="n32236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, from oculus, <hi rend="ital">dearest</hi> (cf. ocellus): <cit><quote lang="la">oculissime homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valuistin' oculissimum ostium?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: oculissimum, carissimum, Plautus: oculissimum ostium amicae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=179" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 179</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oculitus: <entryFree id="n32237" type="main" key="o^cu^li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>oculus</etym>, <sense id="n32237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as one's own eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">most dearly</hi>: amare, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 27 sq.</bibl>; cf.: oculitus quoque dicitur, ut funditus, penitus, quo significatur tam carum esse, quam oculum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=179" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 179</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oculo: <entryFree id="n32238" type="main" key="o^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n32238.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make to see</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n32238.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32238.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enlighten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in agnitionem veritatis oculare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Idol. Van. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32238.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make visible</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestem purpurā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oculus: <entryFree id="n32239" type="main" key="o^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏcŭlus</orth> (sync. oclus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 592 dub.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. akshi and aksha, from the root ītsh, videre; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/ssomai, o)/sse</foreign>; Goth. augō; Germ. Auge; Engl. eye</etym>, <sense id="n32239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eye.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32239.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (natura) primum oculos membranis tenuissimis vestivit et saepsit ... sed lubricos oculos fecit et mobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:139 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 139 sq.</bibl>; Cic. de Or. <cb n="OCUL" /> 3, 59, 221: <cit><quote lang="la">venusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Tusc. 5:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminentes,</quote> <trans><tr>prominent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Vatin. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi tanquam speculatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:N. D. 2:57:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Planc. 27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit>: oculos conicere in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix one's eyes upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos conjecit in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 483</bibl></cit>: adicere alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to cast one's eyes upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glance at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eorum ne quem oculos adiciat suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to covet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adicere ad rem aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo nusquam deicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to never turn one's eyes away from</tr>, <tr>to regard with fixed attention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deicere ab aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram figere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix one's eyes upon the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deicere in terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast down to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 146</bibl></cit>: attollere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 688</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 448</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 487</bibl></cit>: deponere, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, Hor C. 1, 36, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">distorquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere,</quote> <trans><tr>to direct hither and thither</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:33" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis cernere,</quote> <trans><tr>to see with one's own eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos auferre spectanti,</quote> <trans><tr>to blind the eyes of an observer</tr>, <tr>to cheat him before his eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ponere sibi aliquid ante oculos. i. e. <hi rend="ital">to imagine to one's self any thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponere oculis suis aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse ante oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to be before one's eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: res posita in oculis, and ante oculos, <hi rend="ital">that lies before one's eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is apparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus ante oculos positis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sunt enim posita ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque meis oculis candida Delos erat,</quote> <trans><tr>before my eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: vivere in oculis, habitare in oculis, <hi rend="ital">to live in the sight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in intercourse with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximā celebritate atque in oculis civium quondam viximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitavi in oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro palam Syracusis in ore atque in oculis provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere in oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep in sight</tr>, <tr>to watch</tr>, <tr>observe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculis omnium submergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ante oculos suos trucidari sinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl>: ab oculis alicujus abire (ire), <hi rend="ital">to leave one's presence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abin' hinc ab oculis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oculis recedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oculis concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(angues) conspecti repente ex oculis abierunt,</quote> <trans><tr>out of sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigii species ex oculis elapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(avem) ablatam ex oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facesserent propere ex urbe ab ore atque oculis populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub oculis alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>before a person's eyes</tr>, <tr>in his presence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub oculis domini esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos honores sub oculis tuis gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub avi oculis necari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sub oculis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 38, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub oculis Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: hunc oculis suis nostrarum numquam quisquam vidit, <hi rend="ital">with his own eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">actually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ante hunc diem meis oculis eam videram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: ad oculum, <hi rend="ital">for display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be seen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ad oculum servientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 3, 22</bibl>.—As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">the apple of my eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my darling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi isti sunt quibus vos oculi estis, quibus vitae estis, quibus deliciae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene vale, ocule mi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit> —Hence, in a double sense: <cit><quote lang="la">par oculorum in amicitiā M. Antonii triumviri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>.—The ancients swore by their eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">si voltis per oculos jurare, nihilo magis facietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32239.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32239.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The power of seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision</hi>: ut eum quoque oculum, quo bene videret, amitteret, <hi rend="ital">lost</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">became blind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 18, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis usurpare rem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>see</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32239.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A luminary</hi>, said of the sun and stars (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): mundi oculus. i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32239.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spot resembling an eye</hi>, as on a panther's hide, a peacock's tail, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonum caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>. —So arch. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus volutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32239.6" n="4" level="3"> Of plants. </sense><sense id="n32239.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bourgeon</hi>: <cb n="ODAR" /> oculos imponere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inoculate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32239.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A bulb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knob</hi> on many roots, on the reed, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seritur harundo bulbo radicis, quem alii oculum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32239.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> aizoum majus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32239.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32239.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A principal ornament</hi>: hi duo illos oculos orae maritimae effoderunt (<hi rend="ital">Corinth and Carthage</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duobus Graeciae oculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Athens and Sparta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32239.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The eye of the soul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mind's eye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam quam nullis nisi mentis oculis videre possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrioribus mentis oculis intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos pascere re aliquā,</quote> <trans><tr>to feast one's eyes on any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concupiscentia oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Joh. 2, 16: fructum oculis (<case>dat.</case>) capere ex aliquā re, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl>: oculi dolent, <hi rend="ital">the eyes ache</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one is afflicted by something seen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 64</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas, pater, oculis dolorem prohibet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forbids me to take offence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: in oculis, <hi rend="ital">in the eye</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti spes, quae in oculis fuerat, utrosque frustrata pariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies et arma in oculis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philotae supplicium in oculis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be beloved</tr>, <tr>esteemed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in oculis multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: ferre, gestare in oculis, <hi rend="ital">to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderat tum, cum, etc....jam fert in oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex te ergo in oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: aequis oculis videre, i. e. <hi rend="ital">contentedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with satisfaction</hi> (like aequo animo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl>: ante oculos, <hi rend="ital">in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors ante oculos debet esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 6</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obvious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul est illud ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit ante oculos Nero,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>set him before you</tr>, <tr>consider him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: ante oculos habere, <hi rend="ital">to keep in mind</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">habe ante oculos hanc esse terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl>; for which (late Lat.) prae oculis: prae oculis habere terrorem futuri judicii, Greg. M. Ep. 2, 48; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 27 al.: nec jam fas ullum prae oculis habent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: ob oculos versari, <hi rend="ital">to be before the mind</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mors (ei) ob oculos versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usu versatur ante oculos vobis Glaucia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 55, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 36, 6</bibl>: ponere aliquid ante oculos, <hi rend="ital">to call up in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">eā (translatione) utimur rei ante oculos ponendae causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora eorum ponite vobis ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem Cottae sibi ante oculos ponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium Cn. Marci sibi proponunt ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem ante oculos ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia eorum vobis ante oculos proponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely: constituere sibi aliquid ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 233:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 233, 3</bibl>: ante oculos ponere (proponere), with ellips. of <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec a re publicā deiciebam oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ocyale: <entryFree id="n32240" type="main" key="O_cy^a^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcyălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Amazons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 163" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocydrome: <entryFree id="n32241" type="main" key="O_cy^dro^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcydrŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)kudro/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n32241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Swiftrunner</hi>, one of Actæon's hounds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocydromus: <entryFree id="n32242" type="main" key="O_cy^dro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcydrŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)ku/dromos</foreign>, <sense id="n32242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Swiftrunner</hi>, one of Actæon's hounds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocymum: <entryFree id="n32243" type="main" key="ocymum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ocymum</orth>, v. ocinum.</entryFree>
ocyor: <entryFree id="n32244" type="main" key="o_cy^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcyor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ōcyssĭmus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōcyus</orth>, more correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">ocior</orth>, etc.</entryFree>
ocypete: <entryFree id="n32245" type="main" key="O_cy^pe^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcypĕtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <sense id="n32245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)kupe/th</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Swift-flier</hi>, one of the Harpies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocypote: <entryFree id="n32246" type="main" key="O_cy^po^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcypŏtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)kupo/th</foreign>, <sense id="n32246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Swift-flier</hi>, one of Actæon's hounds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocyrrhoe: <entryFree id="n32247" type="main" key="O_cyrrho^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcyrrhŏē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcyrhŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wkurro/h</foreign>, <sense id="n32247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Chiron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 638</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ocythous: <entryFree id="n32248" type="main" key="O_cy^tho^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōcythŏus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)ku/qoos</foreign>, <sense id="n32248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Swiftrunner</hi>, one of Actæon's hounds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oda: <entryFree id="n32249" type="main" key="o_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. ode.</entryFree>
odariarius: <entryFree id="n32250" type="gloss" key="o_da^ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdărĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>odarium</etym>, <sense id="n32250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher<pb n="1256" /> <cb n="ODIO" />  of singing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MAGISTER ODARIARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2634</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odarium: <entryFree id="n32251" type="greek" key="o_da^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdărĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)|da/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n32251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ode</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ode: <entryFree id="n32252" type="greek" key="o_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)|dh/</foreign>, <sense id="n32252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a lyric song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ode</hi> (post-class. for carmen), Auct. Carm. Philom. 13; 25.</sense></entryFree>
odefacit: <entryFree id="n32253" type="gloss" key="odefa^cit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">odefăcit</orth>, <itype>dicebant pro olfacit</itype>, quae vox a Graeco <foreign lang="greek">o)smh/</foreign> tracta est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=179" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 179</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
odessos: <entryFree id="n32254" type="main" key="O^dessos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdessos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)odhsso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lower Mœsia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Pontus Euxinus, now <hi rend="ital">Varna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 18, § 45</bibl>.—Also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdyssus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 32, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odeum: <entryFree id="n32255" type="greek" key="o_de_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)|dei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n32255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public building aesigned for musical performances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an odeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odi: <entryFree id="n32256" type="main" key="o_di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdi</orth>, <itype>ōdisse</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n32256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>, odio: osi sunt ab odio, declinasse antiquos testis est C. Gracchus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201</bibl> Müll. From this are formed: <cit><quote lang="la">odis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">odiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">odiebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psa. 73</bibl></cit>; odies, Tert. adv, Marc. 4, 35; <cit><quote lang="la">odiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">odivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 104</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">odientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">odiendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init. —Pass.</hi> oditur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiremur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: oderem and odere, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 228</bibl> P.—Collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> osus sum, C. Gracch. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; and odivit, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13</bibl>. 19, 42), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root badh-, strike, thrust; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)qe/w</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n32256.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hate</hi> (class.; cf.: detestor, abominor, aversor, abhorreo); constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32256.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem omnes oderunt quā viri quā mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor ruri est tua, quam dudum dixeras te odisse aeque atque angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim odisset Clodium Milo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem acerbe et penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 61, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucemque odit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:583" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus est odisse parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hominem odiit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 10</bibl></cit>: semper eos osi sunt, C. Gracch. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=201" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 201</bibl> Müll.: quas (partes) Pompeius odivit, M. Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32256.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos semper osa sum obtuerier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32256.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: oderint dum metuant, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 97</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 136 Rib.); cf. Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita amare oportere, ut si aliquando esset osurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque studere neque odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furialiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic objurgans, quasi oderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:37 al" default="NO">7, 2, 37 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n32256.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to dislike; to be displeased</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexed at</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">illud rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persicos apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi cum cera vacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta odit hiemem et umorem ac fimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">se odisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be ill at ease</tr>, <tr>discontented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 35</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oditur ergo in hominibus innocuis etiam nomen innocuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de mundo non essemus, odiremur a mundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 43</bibl></cit>, n. 2 (but in class. Lat. the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of odi is odio esse; v. odium).</sense></entryFree>
odiatus: <entryFree id="n32257" type="gloss" key="o^dia_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdiātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odium</etym>, <sense id="n32257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosus, odietas (odiatus), inodiatus, perodiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odibilis: <entryFree id="n32258" type="main" key="o^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odi</etym>, <sense id="n32258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves to be hated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 709</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitate ita odibilis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui procax est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odice: <entryFree id="n32259" type="main" key="O_di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōdĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)widikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n32259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Hours</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odicus: <entryFree id="n32260" type="greek" key="o_di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)|diko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odic</hi>, in prosody, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Vict. p. 2501" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Vict. p. 2501</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
odietas: <entryFree id="n32261" type="gloss" key="o^die^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdiĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. ‡ odiatus.</entryFree>
odinolytes: <entryFree id="n32262" type="main" key="o_di_no^ly^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdīnŏlytes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">w)dinolu/ths</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">w)di/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">lu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n32262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that which alleviates the pangs of childbirth</hi> (epithet of the fish called mora. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 6</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
odio: <entryFree id="n32263" type="gloss" key="o^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭo</orth>, v. odi <sense id="n32263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
odiose: <entryFree id="n32264" type="main" key="o^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. odiosus <sense id="n32264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
odiosicus: <entryFree id="n32265" type="hapax" key="o^di^o_si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭōsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odiosus</etym>, a comically formed word for odiosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 19</bibl>. <cb n="ODOM" /></entryFree>
odiosus: <entryFree id="n32266" type="main" key="o^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odium</etym>, <sense id="n32266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etc.</hi> (class.; syn.: invisus, offensus). </sense><sense id="n32266.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosus mihi es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestum et odiosum esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 471</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32266.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">dona odiosa ingrataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosa et inepta amatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus odiosiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosissima natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidis rerum talium odiosum fortasse et molestum est carere,</quote> <trans><tr>it is vexatious</tr>, <tr>unpleasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a hateful manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Dono Persev. 61" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Dono Persev. 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odites: <entryFree id="n32267" type="main" key="O^di_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n32267.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 457</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32267.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odium: <entryFree id="n32268" type="main" key="o^di^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>odi</etym> (syn.: simultas, inimicitia) <sense id="n32268.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hatred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grudge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illwill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aversion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium (est) ira inveterata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in odium alicujus irruere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become hated by him</tr>, <tr>to incur his hatred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non publico modo sed privato etiam odio invisus atque infestus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 39, 15</bibl></cit>.—Odio alicui esse, as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of odi (cf. odi <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod viro esse odio videas, tute tibiodio habeas,</quote> <trans><tr>to be hateful</tr>, <tr>displeasing to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi odioque sum Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faceres, si quis docuisset te ut sic odio esses mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire in odium Graeciae,</quote> <trans><tr>to incur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus odio venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to become hated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium est mihi cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>I am at enmity with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse odio civitati,</quote> <trans><tr>to be hateful to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic odio nemus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi est odio mea fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sit in odio status rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse alicui in odio,</quote> <trans><tr>to be hated by</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno odio in aliquem ferri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be greatly imbittered against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus subire,</quote> <trans><tr>to incur one's hatred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere adversus aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 756</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <trans><tr>to excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sate</tr>, <tr>satisfy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum odium Pompeii suscepistis,</quote> <trans><tr>have brought upon yourselves</tr>, <tr>have incurred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">struere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>, <tr>raise</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 275</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare,</quote> <trans><tr>to appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum me cujuspiam rei odium cepit,</quote> <trans><tr>I have conceived a great aversion for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere odium erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio habere (postclass.),</quote> <trans><tr>to hate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 15, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">odium jejunum,</quote> <trans><tr>on an empty stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32268.1" n="2" level="3"> Ofinanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">odium raphanis cum vite maximum refugitque juxta satos,</quote> <trans><tr>aversion</tr>, <tr>antipathy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus et olea tam pertinaci odio dissident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32268.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32268.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., the object of hatred; hence, <hi rend="ital">an offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi>, said of persons or things: <cit><quote lang="la">optume odio's,</quote> <trans><tr>you are an offence to me</tr>, <tr>I cannot bear you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum odium atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius, insigne odium omnium hominum vel deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque agri, neque urbis odium me umquam percipit,</quote> <trans><tr>disgust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32268.4" n="B" level="2"> As a quality, <hi rend="ital">offensive conduct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatiousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum horas tres fere dixisset, odio et strepitu senatus coactus est aliquando perorare,</quote> <trans><tr>by the disgust they expressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tundendo atque odio denique effecit senex,</quote> <trans><tr>by his tiresome</tr>, <tr>incessant preaching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuo istoc odio,</quote> <trans><tr>with your hateful</tr>, <tr>perverse conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio qui posset vincere regem,</quote> <trans><tr>in insolence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n32269" type="main" key="o_di_um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. odeum, q. v.</entryFree>
odo: <entryFree id="n32270" type="main" key="o_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 2. udo.</entryFree>
odomantes: <entryFree id="n32271" type="main" key="O^do^mantes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdŏmantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdŏmanti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*odomantes</foreign>, <sense id="n32271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace</hi>, <cb n="ODOR" /> <hi rend="ital">on the Strymon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32271.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdŏmantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Odomantes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odontitis: <entryFree id="n32272" type="greek" key="o^donti_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdontītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)donti=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n32272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant good for the toothache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tooth-wort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27</bibl>. 12, 84, § 108.</sense></entryFree>
odontotyrannus: <entryFree id="n32273" type="greek" key="o^donto^tyrannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdontŏtyrannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)dontotu/rannos</foreign> (tooth tyrant), <sense id="n32273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an animal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:33" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odor: <entryFree id="n32274" type="main" key="o^dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdor</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdos</orth>, <itype>like arbos, labos</itype>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root od-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/zw, o)/dwda, o)dmh/</foreign>; whence oleo, olfacio</etym>, <sense id="n32274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi> (class.; cf. fragrantia). </sense><sense id="n32274.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32274.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis odor ad supera fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem avide trahere naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32274.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32274.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pleasant odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfume;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">perfumery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essences</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spices</hi> (syn. odoramenta).—So mostly in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternite lectos, incendite odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendere odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35</bibl>. § 77; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 5, 56, § 146: croceos odores Tmolus mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusus liquidis odoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>perfumed waters</tr>, <tr>ointments</tr>, <tr>balsams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus differtum odoribus conditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragrans Assyrio odore domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara Fumat odore,</quote> <trans><tr>incense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32274.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A disagreeable smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stink</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">nidor, faetor): putidus odor ibi saepe ex sulfure et alumine. Varr L. L. 5, § 25 Müll.: cum odos aut pabuli egestas locum mutare subegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camera odore foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratos odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taeter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabili foeditatis odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensus putrefacti cerebri odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32274.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor suspicionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:61:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 61, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum furta odore persequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">53: res fluit ad interregnum, et est non nullos odor dictaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. 4, 16, 11): <cit><quote lang="la">lucri bonus est odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 204</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi bonus odor sumus Deo in iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a tincture of politeness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odorabilis: <entryFree id="n32275" type="main" key="o^do_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>odoror</etym>, <sense id="n32275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perceptible by smell</hi>, Ambros. Noë, 15, 22.</sense></entryFree>
odoramen: <entryFree id="n32276" type="main" key="o^do_ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>odoro</etym>, <sense id="n32276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perfume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balsam</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
odoramentum: <entryFree id="n32277" type="main" key="o^do_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an odoriferous substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perfume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balsam</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiosiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">STATVTA EX HS., etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phialae plenae odoramentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odorarius: <entryFree id="n32278" type="main" key="o^do_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [odor], <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for perfuming</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">odoraria myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 70</bibl></cit>: MAGISTER, <hi rend="ital">a vender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preparer of spices</hi>, Inscr. Rhein. cl. 11, n. 81; cf.: odorarius, <foreign lang="greek">a)rwmatopw/lhs</foreign>, Gloss. Phil.</sense></entryFree>
odoratio: <entryFree id="n32279" type="main" key="o^do_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>odoror</etym>. <sense id="n32279.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smell</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qualis est haec aurium delectatio, tales sunt oculorum et tactionum et odorationum et saporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32279.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sense of smelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratio in duas nares a summo artifice divisa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
