odorativus: <entryFree id="n32280" type="main" key="o^do_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odoro</etym>, <sense id="n32280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odoriferous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odoratus: <entryFree id="n32281" type="main" key="o^do_ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>, from odoro.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32282" type="main" key="o^do_ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>odoror</etym>, <sense id="n32282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smell.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32282.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), eorum jucundus non gustatus solum. sed odoratus etiam, et spectatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32282.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32282.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sense of smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil necesse est de gustatu et odoratu loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insecta habent oculos, aliqua et odoratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 4, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32282.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi> which a thing gives out, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odorifer: <entryFree id="n32283" type="main" key="o^do_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n32283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spreading odors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odoriferous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n32283.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">panacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:309" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32283.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Producing perfumes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens odorifera, i. e. Persae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 11, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32283.3" n="II" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habemus ista odorifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus sanctae religionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spirit. Sanct. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1257" /> <cb n="OEAG" /></sense></entryFree>
odorificatus: <entryFree id="n32284" type="main" key="o^do_ri^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odor-facio</etym>, <sense id="n32284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made to emit pleasant odor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 8, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odorisequus: <entryFree id="n32285" type="hapax" key="o^do_ri^se^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrĭsĕquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>odor-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n32285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows the scent</hi> (of a trail): canes, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Metr, p. 2426</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odoro: <entryFree id="n32286" type="main" key="o^do_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>odor</etym>, <sense id="n32286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a smell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fragrance to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perfume</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleo, fragro): odorant aëra fumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum sulfure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1430</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that emits an odor;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">sweet-smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi odorato referam sudantia ligno Balsama?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectare odorato spargit corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratis ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:574" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indi,</quote> <trans><tr>in whose country sweetsmelling spices grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:658" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: dux, <hi rend="ital">the prince of the Parthians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Assyrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who border on Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 64.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina mustis odoratiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratissimi flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odoror: <entryFree id="n32287" type="main" key="o^do_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smell at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine by smelling</hi> (cf. olfacio). </sense><sense id="n32287.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32287.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to smell out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect by the scent; to scent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo odorans, quasi canis venaticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultures sagacius odorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 69, 88, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32287.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32287.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To aspire to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi> a thing, in a contemptuous sense; <hi rend="ital">to snuff</hi>, as a dog: <cit><quote lang="la">quos odorari hunc decemviratum suspicamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32287.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To search out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorabantur omnia et pervestigabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid futurum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles enim tu haec festive odorari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim ex Fabio odorere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagacius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorandi vias occultas sagax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32287.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To get an inkling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smattering of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratus philosophiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem leviter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odorus: <entryFree id="n32288" type="main" key="o^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emitting a scent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odorous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for odoratus). </sense><sense id="n32288.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32288.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sweet-smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor, i. e. myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll. dub.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 177</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nardum Syriacum odorissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32288.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ill-smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumen odorum Sulfure,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 324</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n32288.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that tracks by the smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keenscented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odora canum vis (= copia odororum canum),</quote> <trans><tr>pack of sharp-scented hounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
odos: <entryFree id="n32289" type="main" key="o^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏdos</orth>, v. odor <sense id="n32289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
odrysae: <entryFree id="n32290" type="main" key="Odry^sae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Odrysae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)odru/sai</foreign>, <sense id="n32290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Hebrus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rumili</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>.—Written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Odrŭsae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32290.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Odrysĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Odrysian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tereus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Rhesus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Tereus</tr>, <tr>king of Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 273" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>of Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:440" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 440</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Odrysĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Odrysian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Orpheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 100</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Odrysii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Odrysians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thracians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
odynolytes: <entryFree id="n32291" type="main" key="o_dy_no^ly^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōdȳnŏlytes</orth>, v. odinolytes.</entryFree>
odyssea: <entryFree id="n32292" type="main" key="O^dysse_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏdyssēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)odussei/a</foreign>. <sense id="n32292.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Odyssey of Homer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:375" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 375</bibl>.—Gr. <case>acc.</case> Odyssian, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 11:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32292.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poem of Livius Andronicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Odysseae portus</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">*)odussei/a a)/kra</foreign>, Ptol.), <hi rend="ital">a promontory at the southern extremity of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 87</bibl></sense></entryFree>
oea: <entryFree id="n32293" type="main" key="Oea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Africa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tripolis</hi>, Mela. 1, 7, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:257" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 17</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n32293.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas Oeensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:257" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 257</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Œa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeagrus: <entryFree id="n32294" type="main" key="Oea_^grus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeā^grus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)/agros</foreign>, <sense id="n32294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of</hi> <cb n="OEDI" /> <hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Orpheus</hi>, Ov Ib. 484; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32294.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeā^grĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)a/grios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Œagrian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oeagrius Hebrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemus,</quote> <trans><tr>where Orpheus was torn in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcius Oeagrios pulsabat pectine nervos,</quote> <trans><tr>played on the cithara like Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oeanthe: <entryFree id="n32295" type="main" key="Oeanthe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeanthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Ozolian Locrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oean-thia</orth>, <itype>Mela, 2</itype>, 3.</sense></entryFree>
oebalia: <entryFree id="n32296" type="main" key="Oeba^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)bali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 125</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oebalus: <entryFree id="n32297" type="main" key="Oeba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)/balos</foreign>, <sense id="n32297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Tyndarus and grandfather of Helen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under whose guidance the Parthenians went to Lower Italy and founded Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 78" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32297.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Caprea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Telon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 734</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32297.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebălĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)bali/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an Œbalide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oebalides puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hyacinthus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:590" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laberis, Oebalide, i. e. Hyacinthe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oebalides,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:293" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 293</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebă-lĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Castor and Pollux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:705" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 705</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32297.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32297.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Œbalian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicor in terras, Oebali nympha, tuas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 126</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n32297.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oebalides matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:230" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 230</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32297.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oebălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)ba/lios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n32297.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Œbalian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oebalii fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:422" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 422</bibl></cit>: manus. <hi rend="ital">of Castor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 6:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 220</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hyacinthus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:173:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 173, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Hyacinthus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paelex,</quote> <trans><tr>Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <trans><tr>of Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <trans><tr>Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:822" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 822</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32297.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:260" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oechalia: <entryFree id="n32298" type="main" key="Oecha^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oechălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)xali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32298.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 35" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32298.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Messenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>. Hence, </sense><sense id="n32298.3" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oechălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)xali/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a female Œchalian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oecleus: <entryFree id="n32299" type="main" key="Oecleus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oecleus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)kleu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Amphiarāus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grandfather of Alcmœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 128" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 128</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n32299.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeclīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)klei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Œcleus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Amphiarāus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 317</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeclus: <entryFree id="n32300" type="main" key="Oeclus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeclus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 450</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeconomia: <entryFree id="n32301" type="greek" key="oeco^no^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oecŏnŏmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)konomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the management of household affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestic economy;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a proper division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">economy</hi> (of an oration, a play, etc.; post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">written as Greek,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 11</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Hermogenes judicium, partitionem, ordinem, quaeque elocutionis sunt, subicit oeconomiae, quae, Graece appellata ex curā rerum domesticarum et hic per abusionem posita, nomine Latino caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:9" default="NO">1, 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeconomicus: <entryFree id="n32302" type="greek" key="oeco^no^mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oecŏnŏmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)konomiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n32302.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to domestic economy; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">oecŏnŏmĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a work of Xenophon on domestic economy.</hi> in eo libro, qui Oeconomicus inscribitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32302.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a proper</hi> (oratorical) <hi rend="ital">division</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arrangement; orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oeconomica totius causae dispositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oeconomus: <entryFree id="n32303" type="greek" key="oeco^no^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oecŏnŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)kono/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n32303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a housekeeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi> (post-class. for dispensator rei familiaris; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 45, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 18, § 35</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">oecūmĕnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)koumeniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the whole inhabited world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">œcumenical</hi> (post-class.), Eckhel. D. N. t. 3, p. 336; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 372.</sense></entryFree>
oecus: <entryFree id="n32304" type="greek" key="oecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n32304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a room</hi> in a house; <hi rend="ital">a hall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saloon</hi> (only in Vitr. and Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">oeci magni, in quibus matresfamiliarum cum lanificis habent sessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl>; cf. Becker's Gallus, 2, p. 189 (2d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
oedipus: <entryFree id="n32305" type="main" key="Oedi^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oedĭpus</orth>, <itype>ŏdis and i</itype> (<sense id="n32305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Oedipŏdis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Oedipum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Oedipŏde, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:513" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 513</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oedipo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">plur. acc.</hi> Oedipodas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:26:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 26, 10</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)di/pous</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n32305.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> <cb n="OENO" /> <hi rend="ital">son of Laius and Jocasta.</hi> He unwittingly killed his father; he solved the riddle of the Sphinx, and unknowingly married his own mother, who had by him Eteocles, Polyneices, Ismene, and Antigone; <cit><quote lang="la">when the incest was discovered, he put out his own eyes, and wandered forth to Athens, where a temple was afterwards dedicated to him,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 66" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:67" default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:242" default="NO">242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 470</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 609</bibl>; Sen. Oedip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13</bibl>, sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 62:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 62, 1</bibl>.—Prov. for <hi rend="ital">a solver of enigmas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti orationi Oedipo Opus conjectore est, qui Sphingi interpres fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: Davus sum, non Oedipus, <hi rend="ital">I am no Œdipus</hi> (that can solve all riddles), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 23</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32305.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oedĭpŏdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)dipo/dhs</foreign>, a collat. form for Oedipus, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 289</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impii Oedipodae nuptiales faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 496" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">163</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Oedipoda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 942" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 942</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32305.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oedĭpŏdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)dipodi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fountain in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after Œdipus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32305.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oedĭpŏdīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Œdipus;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Polyneices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:313" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 313</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oedipodionidae fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Eteocles and Polyneices</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:216" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32305.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oedĭpŏdīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)dipodio/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œdipus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thebœ</hi>, Ov M. 15, 429; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 407</bibl> (where others read Oedipodionidas, from <itype>Oedipodionis, idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>): <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sphinx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:505" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 801</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32305.6" n="II" level="1"> Oedipus Colonēus, <hi rend="ital">the title of a tragedy of Sophocles</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*oi)di/pous e)pi\ *kolwnw=|</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> 12; <hi rend="ital">and of a tragedy of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oeensis: <entryFree id="n32306" type="main" key="Oeensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeensis</orth>, e. v. Oea.</entryFree>
oenanthe: <entryFree id="n32307" type="greek" key="oenanthe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenanthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)na/nqh</foreign>. <sense id="n32307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The grape of the wild vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 61, § 132</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32307.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thorny plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimpinella-like dropwort</hi>: Oenanthe pimpinelloides, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 24, 95, § 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32307.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> parra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 45, § 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32307.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Œnanthe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Ptolemy Epiphanes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenanthinus: <entryFree id="n32308" type="greek" key="oenanthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenanthĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)na/nqinos</foreign>, <sense id="n32308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made from the grape of the wild vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 18, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oenanthium: <entryFree id="n32309" type="main" key="oenanthi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenanthĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. oleum, unguentum), <sense id="n32309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ointment made from the grape of the wild vine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeneus: <entryFree id="n32310" type="main" key="Oeneus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oineu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Ætolia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Calydon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Althœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Meleager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tydeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Dejanira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gorgo</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:281 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 281 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 172" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:165" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">586</bibl>; Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n32310.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nhi/+s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Œneus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Dejanira</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 583" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 583</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32310.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nh/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Œnean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oeneius heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tydeus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32310.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nh/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Œnean</hi>: Oeneos per agros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Calydon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ætolia</hi>, Ov M. 8, 281.—</sense><sense id="n32310.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Œneus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at manus Oenidae variat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Meleager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 414</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:690" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 690</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et generum Oeniden, Appule Daune, tuum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diomedes</tr>, <tr>son of Tydeus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 512</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n32311" type="main" key="Oene_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Oeneus, C.</entryFree>
oeniadae: <entryFree id="n32312" type="main" key="Oenia^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeniădae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nia/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n32312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Acarnania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 24</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
oenides: <entryFree id="n32313" type="main" key="Oeni_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Oeneus, D.</entryFree>
oenigenos: <entryFree id="n32314" type="gloss" key="oeni^ge^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenĭgĕnos</orth>, <itype>unigenitos</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=195" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 195</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
oenobreches: <entryFree id="n32315" type="spur" key="oeno^bre^ches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏbrĕches</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)nobrexh/s</foreign>, a read. for onobrychis, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 98, § 155</bibl>.</entryFree>
oenococtus: <entryFree id="n32316" type="greek" key="oeno^coctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏcoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hybr., from <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>-coctus</etym>, <sense id="n32316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stewed in wine</hi> (post Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vituli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:47" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 74</bibl></cit> porcellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl> (al. oenogaratus).</sense></entryFree>
oenogaratus: <entryFree id="n32317" type="hapax" key="oeno^ga^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏgărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oenogarum</etym>, <sense id="n32317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cooked with wine-sauce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit> (al. oenococtus).</sense></entryFree>
oenogarum: <entryFree id="n32318" type="greek" key="oeno^ga^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏgărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)no/garon</foreign>, <sense id="n32318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winesauce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenomaus: <entryFree id="n32319" type="main" key="Oeno^ma^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏmăus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)no/maos</foreign>, <sense id="n32319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Elis and Pisa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Hippodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandfather of Atreus and Thyestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father-in-law of Pelops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:250" default="NO">250</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 398 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:274" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 274</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32319.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a tragedy of Attius</hi>: Oenomao<pb n="1258" /> <cb n="OESY" />  tuo nihil utor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 7.</sense></entryFree>
oenomeli: <entryFree id="n32320" type="greek" key="oeno^me^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏ-mĕli</orth>, <itype>ĭtos</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏmĕlum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 3, 11</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)no/meli</foreign>, <sense id="n32320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine-honey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of mead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
oenone: <entryFree id="n32321" type="main" key="Oeno_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oinw/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n32321.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Phrygian nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Cebren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Paris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but afterwards deserted by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32321.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for the island of Ægina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenophorium: <entryFree id="n32322" type="gloss" key="oeno^pho^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏphŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)nofo/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n32322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-basket</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenophorum: <entryFree id="n32323" type="greek" key="oeno^pho^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏ-phŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oinofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n32323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-holder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-basket of unknown shape</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:426" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 426</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:11" default="NO">7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:140" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 89</bibl>; cf. Becker's Gallus, 3, p. 233 (2d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
oenophorus: <entryFree id="n32324" type="greek" key="Oeno^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏ-phŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oinofo/pos</foreign>, <sense id="n32324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wine-carrier</hi>, a female statue of Praxiteles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenopia: <entryFree id="n32325" type="main" key="Oeno^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nopi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for the island of Ægina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 472</bibl> and 473 Jahn <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32325.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏ-pĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œnopia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Œnopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 490</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oenopion: <entryFree id="n32326" type="main" key="Oeno^pi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏpĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nopi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n32326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Merope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=673" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 673</bibl>; Germ. Arat. 656; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Ar. 1182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenopius: <entryFree id="n32327" type="main" key="Oeno^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Oenopia, II.</entryFree>
oenopolium: <entryFree id="n32328" type="greek" key="oeno^po_li_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏ-pōlīum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)nopwlei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n32328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vintry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oenothera: <entryFree id="n32329" type="greek" key="oeno^the_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏthēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">oenŏthēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oinoqh/ra</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">oi)noqhri/s</foreign> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏ-thēra</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">onŏthūris</orth>), <sense id="n32329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the juice of which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunk in wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produces sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onothera, sive onear, hilaritatem afferens in vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 111</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> onothurim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 17</bibl>. 102, § 167; 26, 14, 87, § 146.</sense></entryFree>
oenotria: <entryFree id="n32330" type="main" key="Oeno_tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenōtrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)nwtri/a</foreign>. <sense id="n32330.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the extreme south-eastern part of Italy</hi>, in the oldest geography of that country (afterwards the territory of the Bruttians and Lucanians): <cit><quote lang="la">Oenotria dicta est vel a vino optimo, quod in Italiā nascitur, vel ut Varro dicit ab Oenotro rege Sabinorum. Alii Itali fratrem Oenotrum tradunt ex Arcadiā in Italiam venisse cum Pelasgis et-eam sibi cognominem fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 532</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32330.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 2, 262</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 146</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n32330.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenōtrĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">islands near Velia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32330.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenō-trĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oinw/trios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Œnotrian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Italian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oenotria tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 713</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32330.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenōtrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = Oenotrius: <cit><quote lang="la">Oenotri coluere viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oenus: <entryFree id="n32331" type="main" key="oenus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oenus</orth>, <itype>a, um, an ancient form for unus</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32332" type="main" key="Oenu_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenūs</orth>, <case>acc.</case> -unta, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Laconia which flows into the Eurotas</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Kelefina</hi>, Liv 34, 28, 1.</sense></entryFree>
oenusa: <entryFree id="n32333" type="main" key="Oenu_sa" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Chios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>; Mela, 2, 7.</sense></entryFree>
oenusae: <entryFree id="n32334" type="main" key="Oenu_sae" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oenūsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three islands near Messenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oeonae: <entryFree id="n32335" type="main" key="Oeo_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fabulous islands in the north of Europe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quīs ovis avium et avenis incolae vivant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oeonistice: <entryFree id="n32336" type="greek" key="oeo_nisti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oeōnistĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)wnistikh</foreign>, <sense id="n32336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the divination of the augurs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augury</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 894</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oestrus: <entryFree id="n32337" type="greek" key="oestrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oestrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)=stros</foreign>. <sense id="n32337.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gad-fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse-fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breese</hi> (pure Lat. asilus): <cit><quote lang="la">volitans, cui nomen asilo Romanum est, oestrum Graii vertere vocantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascuntur in extremis favis apes grandiores, quae ceteras fugant: oestrus vocatur hoc malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 47</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32337.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi> of a prophet or poet, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enthusiasm</hi> (in post-Aug. poets), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 123</bibl>; cf.: oestrum furor Graeco vocabulo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=195" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 195</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oesus: <entryFree id="n32338" type="main" key="oesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oesus</orth>, <itype>an ancient form for usus</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
oesyma: <entryFree id="n32339" type="main" key="Oesy^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oesyma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oesypum: <entryFree id="n32340" type="greek" key="oesy^pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oesypum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)/supos</foreign>, <sense id="n32340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the greasy sweat and dirt of unwashed wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 4, 10, § 28</bibl>.—Used as a cosmetic by the Roman ladies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 354</bibl>. <cb n="OFFE" /></sense></entryFree>
oeta: <entryFree id="n32341" type="main" key="Oeta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oeta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oetē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*oi)/th</foreign>, <sense id="n32341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mountain range between Thessaly and Ætolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Hercules ascended the funeral pile</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Katavothron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 13, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 800</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 862" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 862</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">204</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 201</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi deserit Hesperus Oeten,</quote> <trans><tr>your wish is gratified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32341.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oe-taeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Œta</hi>: in monte Oetaeo, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 807</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Oetaeus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:349" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 349</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oetor: <entryFree id="n32342" type="gloss" key="oetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oetor</orth>, <itype>3, an old form for utor</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
oetum: <entryFree id="n32343" type="greek" key="oetum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oetum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi)=ton</foreign>, <sense id="n32343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ofella: <entryFree id="n32344" type="main" key="o^fella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏfella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>offa</etym>, <sense id="n32344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morsel</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:221:1" default="NO">14, 221, 1</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 383.—</sense><sense id="n32344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 46, 840</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32345" type="main" key="Ofella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ofella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Lucretius Ofella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:88" default="NO" valid="yes">88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ofellus: <entryFree id="n32346" type="main" key="O^fellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏfellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Stoic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offa: <entryFree id="n32347" type="main" key="offa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n32347.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morsel;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">a little ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pellet</hi> made of flour: antiqui offam vocabant abscisum globi formā, ut manu glomeratam pultem, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. poenitam offam, p. 242 Müll.: offam eripere alicui, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 84</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 181</bibl> Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">offam obicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: inter os et offam, = Engl. <hi rend="ital">between the cup and the lip</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 18</bibl> (17), 1; cf.: vetus est proverbium inter os et offam, idem significans quod Graecus ille <foreign lang="greek">paroimiw/dhs</foreign> versus: <foreign lang="greek">*polla\ metacu\ pe/lei ku/likos kai xei/leos a)/krou</foreign>, Apollin. ap. Gell. l. l. § 3.—</sense><sense id="n32347.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n32347.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer illam offam porcinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 165</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offa porcina cum caudā in cenis puris offa penita vocatur, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. penem, p. 230 Müll.: gummi in offas convolutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32347.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A swelling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32347.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A shapeless mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untimely birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abortion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas robusti carminis offas Ingeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offarcinatus: <entryFree id="n32348" type="main" key="offarci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offarcĭnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obfarcino], <sense id="n32348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crammed full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loaded</hi> (eccl. Lat.); with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offarius: <entryFree id="n32349" type="gloss" key="offa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>offa</etym>, <sense id="n32349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dealing with morsels</hi>: cocus, <hi rend="ital">a maker of minced meat</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offatim: <entryFree id="n32350" type="main" key="offa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in bits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by bits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little pieces</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam hercle ego te hic hac (machaerā) offatim conficiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offaveo: <entryFree id="n32351" type="main" key="offa^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offăvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-faveo</etym>, <sense id="n32351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to meet with applause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offectio: <entryFree id="n32352" type="main" key="offecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>officio</etym>, <sense id="n32352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dyeing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offectores: <entryFree id="n32353" type="gloss" key="offecto_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offectōres</orth> <itype>colorum infectores</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <sense id="n32353.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">infectores qui alienum colorem in lanam coiciunt: offectores, qui proprio colori novum officiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 112 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
offectus: <entryFree id="n32354" type="main" key="offectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offectus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from officio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32355" type="main" key="offectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>officio</etym>, <sense id="n32355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bewitching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a charm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 406</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offendiculum: <entryFree id="n32356" type="main" key="offendi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offendĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stumbling-block</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause of offence</hi> (post-Aug.): sunt enim in hac offendicula nonnulla. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:57:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 57, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offendimentum: <entryFree id="n32357" type="main" key="offendi^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offendĭmentum</orth>, v. offendix.</entryFree>
offendix: <entryFree id="n32358" type="gloss" key="offendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offendix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ob, and Sanscr. root bandh, to bind; Goth. binda, a tie; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pei=sma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n32358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the knot</hi> of a band, or <hi rend="ital">the band</hi> itself: Titius ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.: offendices dicebant ligaturae nodos, quibus apex retinebatur. Id, cum pervenisset ad mentum, dicebant offendimentum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl>: offendices nodi quibus libri signantur, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
offendo: <entryFree id="n32359" type="main" key="offendo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obfendo</etym>. <sense id="n32359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi> something (syn.: illido, impingo; class.). </sense><sense id="n32359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">offendere caput ad fornicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coxam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurt himself in the haunch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: pedem, Auct. B. Hisp. <cb n="OFFE" /> 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:720" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 720</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solido,</quote> <trans><tr>against something solid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scopulis offendit puppis,</quote> <trans><tr>strikes on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in redeundo offenderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>ran aground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cornua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quem in cursu capite, aut cubito, aut pectore offendam, aut genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hit upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light upon</hi> a person or thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find</hi> (syn.: deprehendo, invenio): si te hic offendero, moriere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 301 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec, cum ego a foro revortar, facite ut offendam parata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum si cessassem, Domi non offendissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in plateā offendero hac post umquam, periisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imparatum te offendam,</quote> <trans><tr>will come upon you unawares</tr>, <tr>will surprise you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem bonorum sensum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum perfectum templum offendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia aliter ac jusserat offendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32359.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to suffer damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive an injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam Lynceus, qui in tantis tenebris nihil offendat, nusquam incurrat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to stumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit a fault;
