to commit an offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be offensive</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecco, delinquo): in quo ipsi offendissent, alios reprehendissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin quid offenderit, sibi totum, tibi nihil offenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offendebant illi quidem apud gravīs et honestos homines, sed populi judiciis florebant,</quote> <trans><tr>gave offence to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 49, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se apud plebem offendisse de aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in eo solum offenderat, quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: legi, <hi rend="ital">to offend against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violate the law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to offend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit a sin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multis enim offendimus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be offensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nihil aliud offenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 42, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To find fault with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be displeased with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take offence at</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">at credo, in Caesarem probatis, in me offenditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in me aliquid offendistis,</quote> <trans><tr>have taken any offence at me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fail</hi> in any thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have a misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with ill success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud judices offendere, opp. causam iis probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multi viri fortes offenderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam M. Atilius primo accessu ad Africam offenderit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>met with a calamity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. supra.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliquid esset offensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties culpā ducis esset offensum,</quote> <trans><tr>might have met with a defeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum ejusmodi casum exspectans, quo . . . in milibus passuum tribus offendi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl></cit> Kraner ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">at si valetudo ejus offendissit,</quote> <trans><tr>failed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32359.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displease</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">me exquisisse aliquid, in quo te offenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam existimationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem umquam non re, non verbo, non vultu denique offendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensus nemo contumeliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne offendam patrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos splendor offendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extinctum lumen recens offendit nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offendere tot caligas, tot Milia clavorum,</quote> <trans><tr>provoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polypodion offendit stomachum,</quote> <trans><tr>disagrees with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 37, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne colorum claritas aciem oculorum offenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be displeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feel hurt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis rebus meus offendebatur animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non offendar subripi (ista munera),</quote> <trans><tr>so that I am not offended at their being taken from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: componi aliquid de se, offendebatur, <hi rend="ital">he took it ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">of-fensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32359.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Offensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invisus, odiosus, infensus): miserum atque invidiosum offensumque ordinem senatorium!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensum et invisum esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 125</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">offensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the offence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensum est quod eorum, qui audiunt, voluntatem laedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32359.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Offended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incensed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbittered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensus et alienatus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena et offensa populi voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 106</bibl></cit>: offensos merere<pb n="1259" /> <cb n="OFFE" />  deos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 48</bibl>: offensi animi regum, Auct. B. Alex. 32.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum esse offensiorem arbitrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem sibi offensiorem sciebat esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32360" type="hapax" key="offendo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offendo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offence</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 32</bibl> (offendo, offensio, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
offensa: <entryFree id="n32361" type="main" key="offensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. offendo, like repulsa, from repello</etym>, <sense id="n32361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grating against</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n32361.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">donec cerussae similis fiat, nulla dentium offensa,</quote> <trans><tr>and does not grit against the teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine offensis fricantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32361.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32361.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatred; enmity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin magnā in offensā sim apud Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, a, 2: quod offensae fuerit in istā cunctatione, te subisse, <hi rend="ital">to incur hatred</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimam contrahere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall into disgrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensam meruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:1:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause hatred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne minus gratiae quam offensae mereamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinceri et sine offensā in diem Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32361.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An offending against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violating</hi> a law, <hi rend="ital">an offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime</hi> (mostly in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">offensa edicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis offensae contrahere culpam, Cod. Th. 4, 11, 1: sub quālibet culpae aut erroris offensā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:10:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensae veteris reus atque tacendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 105</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32361.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An injury</hi> received, <hi rend="ital">an offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affront</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi> (perh. only since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensas vindicet ense suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in offensis exorabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ejusmodi offensas emetiendum est confragosum hoc iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32361.6" n="2" level="3"> Of a state of injury, <hi rend="ital">a complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconvenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine offensā corporis animique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid offensae in cenā sensit,</quote> <trans><tr>indisposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. An. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offensaculum: <entryFree id="n32362" type="main" key="offensa_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>offenso</etym>, <sense id="n32362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tripping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stumbling</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n32362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris offensaculis contusa crura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32362.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the object against which one stumbles, <hi rend="ital">a stumbling-block</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis ecce nostro fixus offensaculo est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius nostris offensacula pedibus latenter opponit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opt. D. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offensatio: <entryFree id="n32363" type="main" key="offensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hitting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striking against</hi> any thing (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32363.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut offensatione illā (hastae) commoneretur (Demosthenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32363.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stumbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tripping; a slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debemus patienter ferre offensationes memoriae labentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:25:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 25, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offensator: <entryFree id="n32364" type="main" key="offensa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who stumbles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blunders in speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offensibilis: <entryFree id="n32365" type="main" key="offensi^bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensĭbĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liable to stumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stumbling</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui offensibilibus et caducis gressibus per viam mortis incedit (al. offensilibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offensilis: <entryFree id="n32366" type="main" key="offensi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensĭlis</orth>, v. offensibilis.</entryFree>
offensio: <entryFree id="n32367" type="main" key="offensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking against</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">a tripping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stumbling</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32367.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedis offensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensiones pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: dentium, Lact. Opif. Dei, 10, 13. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensione sonitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32367.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, that against which one stumbles, <hi rend="ital">a stumbling-block</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil offensionis haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32367.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32367.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An offence</hi> given to any one; <cit><quote lang="la">hence,</quote> <trans><tr>disfavor</tr>, <tr>aversion</tr>, <tr>disgust</tr>, <tr>dislike</tr>, <tr>hatred</tr>, <tr>discredit</tr>, <tr>bad reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 178</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">existimatio offensa nostri ordinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">117): sapiens praetor offensionem vitat aequalitate decernendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere invidiam atque offensionem apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in odium offensionemque populi Romani inruere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensionem excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensiones accendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc apud alios offensionem habet,</quote> <trans><tr>displeases them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32367.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An offence</hi> which one receives; <hi rend="ital">displeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere ad res certas vitiosam offensionem atque fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: mihi majori offensioni sunt quam delectationi possessiunculae meae, <cb n="OFFE" /> <hi rend="ital">give me more vexation than pleasure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32367.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A complaint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition; an accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mishap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">failure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum offensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves solent offensiones esse ex gravibus morbis, si qua culpa commissa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet enim nihil quod in offensione deperdat,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>if he loses his cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensiones belli,</quote> <trans><tr>misfortunes</tr>, <tr>defeats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensionum et repulsarum ignominia,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>refusals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32367.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which causes one to offend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stumbling-block</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">unusquisque offensiones oculorum suorum abiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemini dantes ullam offensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis offensionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 8 al.</sense></entryFree>
offensiuncula: <entryFree id="n32368" type="main" key="offensi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>offensio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n32368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeasure; a slight mishap</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si qua offensiuncula facta est animi tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in istā aedilitate offensiuncula accepta,</quote> <trans><tr>some slight check</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offenso: <entryFree id="n32369" type="main" key="offenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offenso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash against</hi> (not in Cic. or Caes.). </sense><sense id="n32369.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suā offensando ut semina rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1059</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1053" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1053</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes offensare capita,</quote> <trans><tr>dash their heads against the wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32369.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falter</hi> in speaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl>.—(Offensatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 20</bibl>, is a false reading for offensator, q.v.).</sense></entryFree>
offensor: <entryFree id="n32370" type="main" key="offensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiam suis cum offensoribus redire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offensus: <entryFree id="n32371" type="main" key="offensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. offendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32372" type="main" key="offensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. offendo</etym>, <sense id="n32372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shock</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose). </sense><sense id="n32372.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:359" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 359</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32372.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A lighting upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meeting with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per offensus armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:283" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 283</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32372.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin vita in offensu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 941</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offerentia: <entryFree id="n32373" type="main" key="offe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>offero</etym>, <sense id="n32373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presenting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offering</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offero: <entryFree id="n32374" type="main" key="offe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>obtŭli, oblātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-fero</etym>, <sense id="n32374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring before; to present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer; to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi> (class.; cf. obicio, ostendo). </sense><sense id="n32374.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">incommode illis fors obtulerat adventum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opportune te obtulisti mihi obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictamque aciem venientibus offert,</quote> <trans><tr>presents</tr>, <tr>opposes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem offerre,</quote> <trans><tr>to present a false appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 81</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: offerri, mid., <hi rend="ital">to show one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear; to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encounter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in difficillimis rebus praesens auxilium ejus (numinis) oblatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblata religio est,</quote> <trans><tr>a religious scruple struck him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu oblato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex quaedam videbatur oblata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32374.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32374.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose; to bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne offeramus nos periculis sine causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtulimus nos ad prima pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram offerre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tu nunc vides pro tuo caro capite carum offerre me meum caput vilitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte suā leto caput obvius optulit ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1041" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1041</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus oblatis,</quote> <trans><tr>brought forward</tr>, <tr>adduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32374.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proffer; to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow; to inflict</hi>, etc. (cf. promitto, recipio, infero): <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnia ultro suam offerens operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi semper omnia optata offerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui optatissimum beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tantum boni, quod vobis ab dis immortalibus oblatum et datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datum atque oblatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 49, § 103</bibl>: ut nunc hac re mihi opem et auxilium offeras, <hi rend="ital">bring me aid and assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help me</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 360, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui injuriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium virgini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: sibi molestiam atque aerumnam offerre, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 360, 23</bibl>: occasio ad occupandam<cb n="OFFI" />  Asiam oblata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque offert suscepturum,</quote> <trans><tr>offers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus offerebat se intercessurum senatus consulto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblatā facultate in castra sese receperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32374.5" n="2" level="3"> In eccl. Lat. </sense><sense id="n32374.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To offer to God</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:38:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 38, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32374.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To offer up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro filio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 21, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet ipsum Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 9, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
offertor: <entryFree id="n32375" type="main" key="offertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offertor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>offero</etym>, <sense id="n32375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offerer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instruct. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offertorium: <entryFree id="n32376" type="main" key="offerto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offertōrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>). <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place to which offerings were brought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an offertory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">offertorium tali ex causā sumpsit vocabulum. Fertum enim dicitur oblatio, quae altari offertur, et sacrificatur a pontificibus, a quo offertorium nomina tur, quasi propter fertum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offerumenta: <entryFree id="n32377" type="hapax" key="offe^ru^menta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĕrŭmenta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a present;</hi> comically, of <hi rend="ital">a stripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerumentas in tergo habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32378" type="gloss" key="offe^ru^menta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĕrŭmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">offerings</hi>: offerumenta dicebant quae offerebant (sc. dis), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
offex: <entryFree id="n32379" type="main" key="offex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>officio</etym>, <sense id="n32379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hinderer</hi>: offex, impeditor, qui officit, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
officialis: <entryFree id="n32380" type="main" key="offi^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>officium</etym>, <sense id="n32380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">official</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n32380.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri officiales,</quote> <trans><tr>which treat of duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <trans><tr>official performances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32380.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a magistrate's servant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an official</hi> (for the class. apparitor), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 12, 6</bibl>: universi officiales diversorum officiorum, Cod. Th. 8, 7, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2952</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32380.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulationi occurrant necesse est officiales suae, ira, discordia, odium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
officialitas: <entryFree id="n32381" type="main" key="offi^ci^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>officialis</etym>, <sense id="n32381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a body of attendants</hi> (late Lat.), Inc. Quu. ex Utroq. Test. 101.</sense></entryFree>
officina: <entryFree id="n32382" type="main" key="offi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from opificina, from opifex; the uncontracted prim. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">opĭfĭcīna</orth>, is still found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 7</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:83" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Mai</etym>, <sense id="n32382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a workshop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manufactory</hi> (class.; cf. fabrica). </sense><sense id="n32382.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim quicquam ingenuum potest habere officina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituit officinam Syracusis in regiā maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a manufactory of arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, ferraria, Auct. B. Afr. 20: aerariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fullonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plastarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tingentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonstrinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:165 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 165 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promercalium vestium,</quote> <trans><tr>a shop in which garments are made for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetariorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a place where fish are salted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officina monetae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum graves Cyclopum Volcanus ardens urit officinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32382.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in econom. lang. = ornithon, a place where fowls are kept, in order to lay their eggs and hatch their young, <hi rend="ital">a poultry-house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">yard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32382.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnis corporibus facilis officina sequaci materia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32382.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a workshop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manufactory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laboratory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematici, poëtae, musici, medici denique ex hac tamquam omnium artium officinā profecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsorum commentariorum, et chirographorum officina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirandi pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rhetorum officinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus ejus officina eloquentiae habita est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptelarum omnis generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">39, 8, 7: crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanarum calamitatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
officinator: <entryFree id="n32383" type="main" key="offi^ci_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>officina</etym>, <sense id="n32383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who keeps a workshop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a master-workman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an artificer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artist</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1090</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">OFFICINATORES ET NVMMVLARI OFFICINARVM ARGENTARIARVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">OFF. and OFFIC. MONETAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
officinatrix: <entryFree id="n32384" type="gloss" key="offi^ci_na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcīnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>officinator</etym>, <sense id="n32384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="1260" /> <cb n="OFFI" /> <hi rend="ital">woman that keeps a workshop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4257</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
officio: <entryFree id="n32385" type="main" key="offi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>ēci, ectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n32385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [ob-facio], <hi rend="ital">to come in the way of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thwart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi> (class.; syn. obsto). </sense><sense id="n32385.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32385.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quidem paululum, inquit, a sole: offecerat videlicet apricanti,</quote> <trans><tr>hindered him from sunning himself</tr>, <tr>stood before him so as to intercept the sunshine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 92</bibl></cit>: luminibus, <hi rend="ital">to obstruct one's light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus vel altius tollendi aedes aut non tollendi, ne luminibus vicini officiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:31" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23" default="NO">23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">39, 1, 5 et saep.—So, in a fig.: nec mentis quasi luminibus officit altitudo fortunae et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demoliri ea, quorum altitudo officeret auspiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa umbra terrae soli officiens noctem efficit,</quote> <trans><tr>intervening before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii in angustiis ipsi sibi properantes officerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium itineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 6</bibl></cit>: prospectui, Auct. B. Afr. 52.—</sense><sense id="n32385.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quapropter simul inter se retrahuntur et extra Officiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are impeded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:763" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 763</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:776" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 776</bibl> (iter, Auct. B. Afr. 61, is prob. a gloss).—</sense><sense id="n32385.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand in the way of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be detrimental</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurtful to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurt</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obsisto, adversor, noceo): promitto tibi non offerturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur te mihi offers, ac meis commodis, officio simulato, officis et obstas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor animi auribus officit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomini, i. e. famae, Liv. praef. 1: officiunt laetis frugibus herbae,</quote> <trans><tr>hurt by shutting off light and moisture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactucae officiunt claritati oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero Isocrati, quominus haberetur summus orator, offecit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
officiosa: <entryFree id="n32386" type="main" key="Offi^ci^o_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Offĭcĭōsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>officiosus</etym>, <sense id="n32386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Malvas. Marm. Fels. p. 57.</sense></entryFree>
officiose: <entryFree id="n32387" type="main" key="offi^ci^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. officiosus <sense id="n32387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
officiositas: <entryFree id="n32388" type="main" key="offi^ci^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>officiosus</etym>, <sense id="n32388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obligingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readiness to serve</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 478</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
officiosus: <entryFree id="n32389" type="main" key="offi^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>officium</etym>. <sense id="n32389.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of courtcousness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready to serve</hi> (esp. towards one's superiors; class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. studiosus): homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne quisquam, qui tibi officiosior, liberaliorque videatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 45, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiosissima natio candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>; for which with <hi rend="ital">summe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines Lampsaceni summe in omnes cives Romanos officiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32389.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dutiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32389.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭō-sus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an official</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi> at a bath, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligingly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">officiose et amice factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 81</bibl></cit>: aliquid facere, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 247</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum etiam Pilia (fecit), sed illa officiosius, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiosissime venit ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 21</bibl></cit> (32) <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
officiperda: <entryFree id="n32390" type="main" key="offi^ci^perda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭperda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭper-dus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>officium-perdo</etym>. <sense id="n32390.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who makes an ill use of the favors of others</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Distich. 3, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32390.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who throws away his labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is not rewarded</hi>: officiperdi, qui sui laboris non habent remunerationem, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
officium: <entryFree id="n32391" type="main" key="offi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for opificium, opus and facio</etym>, qs. that which one does for another, <sense id="n32391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a service</hi>, whether of free will or of (external or moral) necessity (class.; cf.: studium, beneficium, meritum, munus). </sense><sense id="n32391.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A voluntary service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>, rendered to one whose claim to it is recognized; <cit><quote lang="la">while beneficium is a service rendered where there is no claim: officium esse filii, uxoris, earum personarum, quas necessitudo suscitat et ferre opem jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n32391.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">altera sententia est, quae definit amicitiam paribus officiis ac voluntatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosum sane genus hominum officia exprobrantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est vicissitudine studiorum officiorumque jucundius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: filicem cum officio vicini decidere, <hi rend="ital">so as to do him a service</hi>, Col. <cb n="OFFI" /> 2, 14, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">summo officio praeditus homo,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly obliging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 135</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32391.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32391.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A ceremonial observance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ceremony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendance</hi> (on a festive or solemn occasion; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): officio togae virilis interfui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine solenni officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sollenne nuptiarum celeberrimo officio deductum ad se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad officium venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicto statim novorum consulum officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio salutationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitans praeter navigantium officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia prosequentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod supremis in matrem officiis defuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>at the payment of the last offices</tr>, <tr>at the funeral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium cras Primo sole mihi peragendum in valle Quirini,</quote> <trans><tr>a ceremonial visit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:133 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 133 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:239" default="NO">3, 239</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32391.5" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">compliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32391.6" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an obligatory service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an obligation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">function</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi> (so most freq. in prose and poetry of all periods): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla vitae pars neque publicis neque privatis neque forensibus neque domesticis in rebus, neque si tecum agas quid, neque, si cum altero contrahas, vacare oflicio potest: in eoque et colendo sita vitae est honestas omnis et in neglegendo turpitudo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>: perfectum officium rectum opinor vocemus, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">kato/rqwma</foreign>: hoc autem commune <foreign lang="greek">kaqh=kon</foreign> vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">an id doles, quia illi suum officium non colunt, quom tu tuum facis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meminisse officium suum,</quote> <trans><tr>to remember one's duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 71</bibl></cit>.—Also, subject., <hi rend="ital">a sense of duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aegre ferat nihil in se esse virtutis, nihil officii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid in eum judicii officiique contuleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere, utrum apud eos pudor atque officium an timor valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do one's duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus officiis amicitiae servatis,</quote> <trans><tr>observe all the obligations of friendship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisfacere officio,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium suum deserere,</quote> <trans><tr>to disregard one's duty</tr>, <tr>not perform it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedere ab officio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deesse officio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii duxit,</quote> <trans><tr>considered it his duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">canes funguntur officiis luporum,</quote> <trans><tr>act the part of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 46</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pes neque mens satis suum officium facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: officium corporis, <hi rend="ital">the function</hi> or <hi rend="ital">property of a body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 336</bibl> and 362.— </sense><sense id="n32391.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32391.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an official duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">toti officio maritimo M. Bibulus praepositus cuncta administrabat,</quote> <trans><tr>naval service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter equitatus ad cotidianum itineris officium revertitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto legationis officio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destringor officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium (scribae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32391.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointment</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32391.10" n="a" level="4"> Laboriosissimum et maximum, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:91" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova officia excogitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novum officium instituit a voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligationes, quae non propriis viribus consistunt, neque officio judicis, neque praetoris imperio neque legis potestate confirmantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex officio pro aliis interveniunt,</quote> <trans><tr>by virtue of their office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:31:section=14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 31, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32391.11" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr. </sense><sense id="n32391.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The officials</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attendants on a magistrate</hi> = officialium corpus (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sub praetextu adventus officiorum vel militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:74" default="NO">21, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere aliquid apud officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>. 17: officia palatina, <hi rend="ital">officers at the imperial court</hi>, Treb. Poll. Gall. 17, 8.—</sense><sense id="n32391.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">court</hi> of a magistrate: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse me Regulus convenit in praetoris officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offigo: <entryFree id="n32392" type="main" key="offi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-figo</etym>, <sense id="n32392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">furcas circum offigito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lex Puteol. ap. Grut. 207, 1: ita densos offigunt implicantque ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 10</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: in crucem currere ... ut offigantur bis pedes, bis bracchia, Plaut. <cb n="OFFU" /> Most. 2, 1, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">manum alicujus ad ostii tabulam grandi clavo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offilius: <entryFree id="n32393" type="main" key="Offili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Offilĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ofil-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">A. Offilius,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated lawyer</tr>, <tr>a friend and at one time a creditor of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offirmate: <entryFree id="n32394" type="main" key="offirma_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offirmātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. offirmo, <sense id="n32394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
offirmatus: <entryFree id="n32395" type="main" key="offirma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offirmātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from offirmo.</entryFree>
offirmo: <entryFree id="n32396" type="main" key="offirmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offirmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ob-firmo</etym>, <sense id="n32396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi> (class. only in the <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n32396.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertica, quā stabuli fores offirmari solebant, arrepta,</quote> <trans><tr>to fasten, bolt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n32396.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persevere in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum offirmare est viam me, quam decrevi persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <trans><tr>to persist</tr>, <tr>be obstinate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir impius procaciter obfirmat vultum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 21, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ezek. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—So without se, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: censen' posse me offirmare? Ter Eun. 2, 1, 11.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offirmastin' oc cultare, quo te immittas, pessume?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">offirmātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus fortis atque offirmatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin offirmatum quod mihi erat, id me exorat,</quote> <trans><tr>settled</tr>, <tr>resolved on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi videtur illius voluntas obstinatior et in hāc iracundiā offirmatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">offirmātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubbornly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">offirmate resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offla: <entryFree id="n32397" type="main" key="offla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offla</orth>, v. offula.</entryFree>
offlecto: <entryFree id="n32398" type="hapax" key="offlecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offlecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obfl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-flecto</etym>, <sense id="n32398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offoco: <entryFree id="n32399" type="main" key="offo_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offōco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">offuco</orth>; <sense id="n32399.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-faux</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum oflocan das invicem fauces praebuissent (al. effo candas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev.
