Vit. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicumque fluctus ejus offocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 24</bibl></cit>: offucare aquam in fauces ad sorbendum dare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
offrenatus: <entryFree id="n32400" type="main" key="offre_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offrēnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obfr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obfreno], <sense id="n32400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bridled;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">curbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamed</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 323, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offringo: <entryFree id="n32401" type="main" key="offringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offringo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obfr-</orth>), <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-frango</etym>, t. t. of agriculture, i. q. iterare, <sense id="n32401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough a second time; to cross-plough</hi>: terram cum primum arant, proscindere appellant; <cit><quote lang="la">cum iterum, offringere dicunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to cross-plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: offringi terra dicitur, cum iterum transverso sulco aratur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=199" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 199</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
offucia: <entryFree id="n32402" type="main" key="offu_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offūcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ob-fucus</etym>, <sense id="n32402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash</hi> for the face (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n32402.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmentum ullum, neque cerussam Melinumve neque aliam ullam offuciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32402.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id praestigiarum atque offuciarum genus,</quote> <trans><tr>delusions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offuco: <entryFree id="n32403" type="gloss" key="offu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offūco</orth>, v. offoco.</entryFree>
offudas: <entryFree id="n32404" type="gloss" key="offudas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offudas</orth>, <itype>fallacias</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll. (al. offucias; v. offucia).</entryFree>
offula: <entryFree id="n32405" type="main" key="offu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offŭla</orth> (sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">offla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>offa</etym>, <sense id="n32405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small piece</hi> (peculiar to the vulg. lang.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">offula dicta, ut offa minima e suere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 110</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">offulam cum duabus costis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis, spisse componuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polentae caseatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. Fall. 1, 29, 4.—Prov.: quis potest sine offulā vivere? Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cland. 40</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a term of abuse applied to a bad slave: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciat crucis offla, corvorum cibaria?</quote> <trans><tr>this gallows-bird</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offulcio: <entryFree id="n32406" type="main" key="offulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offulcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>) (si), <itype>tum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n32406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stop up</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus spongiā offulciens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis laciniis offulto vulnere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 147, 14.</sense></entryFree>
offulgeo: <entryFree id="n32407" type="main" key="offulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offulgĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>si, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-fulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n32407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon; to appear</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo nova lux oculis offulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrum offulsit conatibus omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:114" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 114</bibl></cit>: species mei amici, Ps. -<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32407.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: lucrum, Ps. -<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus imperii nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
offultus: <entryFree id="n32408" type="main" key="offultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offultus</orth>, a. um, <mood>Part.</mood>, from offulcio.</entryFree>
offundo: <entryFree id="n32409" type="main" key="offundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offundo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>ūdi, ūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obundo</etym>.<pb n="1261" /> <cb n="OGYG" />  <sense id="n32409.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pour before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">around; to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32409.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum (avibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32409.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, mid., <hi rend="ital">to pour itself out; to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut piscibus aqua, nobis aër crassus offunditur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>surrounds us</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor gravissimis quoque viris offunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignis oculorum cum eo igne, qui est ob os offusus, se confudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus offunditur,</quote> <trans><tr>tumbles down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 144, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32409.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi> any thing over a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi noctem quandam rebus offundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec indoctorum animis offusa caligo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si offusa rei publicae sempiterna nox esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum terrorem oculis et auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caliginem oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem incompositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6</bibl></cit>: quibus tenebris est offusa hominis cogitatio, Lact. de Ira, 1, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Inst. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Inst. 7</bibl>. 24, 7.—</sense><sense id="n32409.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To spread over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> a thing with something. </sense><sense id="n32409.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut obscuratur et offunditur luce solis lumen lucernae,</quote> <trans><tr>eclipsed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi clarissimā in luce tenebris offusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32409.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">offusus pavore,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellorum meum pectus memoria obfudit,</quote> <trans><tr>has filled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 4, 10</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">non existimare se tantis tenebris offusam esse rem pnblicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:6" default="NO">2, 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offuscatio: <entryFree id="n32410" type="main" key="offusca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offuscātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>offusco</etym>, <sense id="n32410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darkening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscuring;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">a vilifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrading</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res Carn. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 41, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
offusco: <entryFree id="n32411" type="main" key="offusco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offusco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-fusco</etym>, <sense id="n32411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">to vilify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam offuscata sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 2, § 9.</sense></entryFree>
offusus: <entryFree id="n32412" type="main" key="offu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">offūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from offundo.</entryFree>
ofilius: <entryFree id="n32413" type="main" key="Ofili^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ofilĭus</orth>, v. Offilius.</entryFree>
ogdoas: <entryFree id="n32414" type="greek" key="ogdo^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ogdŏas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)gdoa/s</foreign>. <sense id="n32414.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the number eight</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 36</bibl>, n. 9.—</sense><sense id="n32414.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">one of the œons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 7</bibl> and 20; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oggannio: <entryFree id="n32415" type="main" key="ogganni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oggannĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obg-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-gannio</etym>, <sense id="n32415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to yelp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snarl</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">growl at</hi> (ante- and post-class.): ogganniunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin centies eadem imperem atque ogganniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet haec se quod, dum vivat, usque ad aurem ogganiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aurem alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oggero: <entryFree id="n32416" type="main" key="ogge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oggĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obg-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-gero</etym>, <sense id="n32416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to proffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">(amor) amarum ad satietatem oggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">osculum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oglasa: <entryFree id="n32417" type="main" key="Oglasa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oglasa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Corsica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Christo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ogulnius: <entryFree id="n32418" type="main" key="Ogulni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ogulnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ogyges: <entryFree id="n32419" type="main" key="O_gy^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgyges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgy-gĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wgu/ghs, *)/wgugos, *)wgu/gios</foreign>, <sense id="n32419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mythic founder and king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bœtia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whose reign a great deluge is said to have occurred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Thebae, quod rex Ogyges aedificarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante cataclysmon Ogygi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 3: hoc factum Ogyge rege dicebant, Varr. Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 8.—Form Ogygus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=179" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 179</bibl> Müll.—Form Ogygius, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 8.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32419.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygĭ-dae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the descendants of Ogyges</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the Thebans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:586" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 586</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32419.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wgu/gios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Ogygian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>, <tr>who was especially honored at Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 48</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Thebans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 589" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelys,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Amphion</tr>, <tr>king of Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: Ogygia moenia, i. e. Thebae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ogygia: <entryFree id="n32420" type="main" key="O_gy^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n32420.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One of the seven daughters of Amphion and Niobe.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 69" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32420.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A gate at Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 69" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32420.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which Calypso was said to have dwelt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ogygidae: <entryFree id="n32421" type="main" key="O_gy^gi^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Ogyges, A.</entryFree>
ogygius: <entryFree id="n32422" type="main" key="O_gy^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōgygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ogyges, B. <cb n="OLEA" /></entryFree>
oh: <entryFree id="n32423" type="main" key="oh"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oh</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an expression for the most various emotions of the mind—for surprise, both joyful and painful; for great pleasure or sorrow; for earnest wishing, admiration, aversion, etc.—<sense id="n32423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oh! O! ah!</hi> oh, tibi ego ut credam, furcifer? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oh, iniquus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oh perii!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oh, probus homo sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 86</bibl></cit>.—Repeated, oh, oh, oh, as an exclamation of lamentation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oh, oh, as an exclamation of exultation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit> (al. oh, al. ohoho).</sense></entryFree>
ohe: <entryFree id="n32424" type="main" key="o^he_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏhē</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n32424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ho! holloa! soho! ho there!</hi> ohe, inquam, si quid audis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ohe, Jam satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 96</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:91:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 91, 1</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
oho: <entryFree id="n32425" type="main" key="o^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏho</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of surprise or joy, <sense id="n32425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oho! aha!</hi> oho, amabo, quid illuc non properas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 32</bibl> (dub. in both passages; al. ohe).</sense></entryFree>
ohoho: <entryFree id="n32426" type="main" key="ohoho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ohoho</orth>, v. oh.</entryFree>
oi: <entryFree id="n32427" type="main" key="oi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oi</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of complaint, of one weeping: <sense id="n32427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> I intro nunc jam. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Oi! ei! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 47</bibl>: oi! hui! id. Phorm, 4, 3, 58.</sense></entryFree>
oica: <entryFree id="n32428" type="main" key="oica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oiei: <entryFree id="n32429" type="main" key="oiei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oiei</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n32429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cry of lamentation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oileus: <entryFree id="n32430" type="main" key="O^i_leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏīleus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype> (ēī) and <itype>ĕŏs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oi+leus</foreign>. <sense id="n32430.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of the Ajax who violated Cassandra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and who was called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from his parentage</hi>, Ajax Oilei (to distinguish him from Ajax Telamonius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl>: nec mihi Oilei proferatur Ajax, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 158, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius ab noxam et furias Ajacis Oilei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form Oileos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos, inquit Antonius, possum tuos Ajaces Oileos nominare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Ajax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmine et ponto moriens Oileus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 662" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 662</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32430.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n32430.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oīlēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Oilean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the son of Oileus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 81" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32430.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏīlĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)oi+lia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Oileus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ajax</hi> (al. Oilides), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:479" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 479</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32430.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏīlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor Oilide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 117 (dub.; Müll. Oiliade).—</sense><sense id="n32430.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oinos: <entryFree id="n32431" type="main" key="oinos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oinos</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, an archaic orthog. for unus, q. v.</entryFree>
oinuorsei: <entryFree id="n32432" type="gloss" key="oinuorsei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oinuorsei</orth>, <itype>for universi</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
olax: <entryFree id="n32433" type="main" key="o^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oleo</etym>, <sense id="n32433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odorous</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olbia: <entryFree id="n32434" type="main" key="Olbi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olbi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32434.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32434.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Nicaea, now <hi rend="ital">Izmid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32434.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olbĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: sinus, now <hi rend="ital">Golfo d' Izmid</hi>, Mela, 1, 19, 4.—</sense><sense id="n32434.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, Mela, 2, 5.—</sense><sense id="n32434.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Sardinia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Terranova</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olbĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Olbia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Olbian</hi>: epistula. <hi rend="ital">from Olbia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>the territory of Olbia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olbiopolis: <entryFree id="n32435" type="main" key="Olbi^o^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olbĭŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Sarmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>.—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olbĭŏpŏlī-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Olbiopolis</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Olbia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Sarmatia;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of that place</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olca: <entryFree id="n32436" type="spur" key="olca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olca</orth>, a false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>; v. oica.</entryFree>
olcades: <entryFree id="n32437" type="hapax" key="Olca^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olcădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Ebro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olciniates: <entryFree id="n32438" type="main" key="Olcini^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olcinĭātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Olcinium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seaport in Illyricum</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Dulcigno</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunes fore Olciniatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olea: <entryFree id="n32439" type="greek" key="o^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n32439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> oleabus, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 40</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">e)lai/a</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n32439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an olive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olive-berry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea ab elaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 108</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas caducas, et albas condire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam cogere, legere, stringere, verberare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:302 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 302 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n32439.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 9</bibl>: agricola cum florem oleae videt, bacam quoque se visurum putat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO">8, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ure maris oleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:741" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 741</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 13</bibl>. <cb n="OLEO" /></sense></entryFree>
oleaceus: <entryFree id="n32440" type="main" key="o^le^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oleum</etym>, <sense id="n32440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the olive-tree;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">like oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oily</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 179</bibl></cit> (al. oleique): <cit><quote lang="la">folia oleacea (al. folia violae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oleagineus: <entryFree id="n32441" type="main" key="o^le^a_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕāgĭnĕus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕāgĭnĭus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕ-āgĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>olea</etym>. <sense id="n32441.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the olive-tree</hi> (for the class. olearius): <cit><quote lang="la">oleagineum seminarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: oleagineis coronis ministri triumphantium utebantur, quod Minerva dea belli esse putabatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n32441.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling an olive-tree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an olive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis oleaginia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32441.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Olive-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">berylli oleagini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oleamen: <entryFree id="n32442" type="main" key="o^le^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>oleum</etym>, <sense id="n32442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oil-ointment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 222" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:269" default="NO">269</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olearis: <entryFree id="n32443" type="main" key="o^le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oil-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleares cotes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which are moistened with oil</tr>, <tr>oil-stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olearius: <entryFree id="n32444" type="main" key="o^le^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oil-</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cella vinaria, olearia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 8, 8, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32444.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an oilgrinder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oil-seller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in velabro olearii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olearos: <entryFree id="n32445" type="main" key="O_le^a^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕăros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĭăros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wle/aros, *)wli/aros</foreign>, <sense id="n32445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Paros</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Antiparos</hi>, Mela, 2, 7, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 126</bibl>.—Form Oliaros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 469</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oleastellus: <entryFree id="n32446" type="main" key="o^le^astellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕastellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>oleaster</etym>, <sense id="n32446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Calabrian species of olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oleaster: <entryFree id="n32447" type="main" key="o^le^aster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕaster</orth>, <itype>stri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>olea</etym>, <sense id="n32447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild olivetree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oleaster</hi>: oleaster, <foreign lang="greek">a)grielai/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 182</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:240" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 89, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 17</bibl> and 24.</sense></entryFree>
oleastrum: <entryFree id="n32448" type="main" key="o^le^astrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. oleaster, Calp.</entryFree>
oleatus: <entryFree id="n32449" type="main" key="o^le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oleum</etym>, <sense id="n32449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moistened with oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put up in oil</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pultes oleatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:208" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olefacio: <entryFree id="n32450" type="gloss" key="o^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. olfacio.</entryFree>
oleitas: <entryFree id="n32451" type="main" key="o^le^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>olea</etym>, <sense id="n32451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the olive-gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olive-harvest</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vindemia et oleitas facta erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 144</bibl>; Minuc. Fel. 17, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olenides: <entryFree id="n32452" type="main" key="O_le^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Olenos.</entryFree>
olenie: <entryFree id="n32453" type="main" key="O_le^ni^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 2. Olenos.</entryFree>
olenius: <entryFree id="n32454" type="main" key="O_le^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Olenos.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32455" type="main" key="Ole^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centurion under Drusus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olenos: <entryFree id="n32456" type="main" key="O_le^nos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/wlenos</foreign>, <sense id="n32456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the husband of Lethœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed with her into a stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 69</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32456.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wleni/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Olenus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoceaque Oleniden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:204" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32457" type="main" key="O_le^nos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/wlenos</foreign>, <sense id="n32457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city in Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Patrœ and Dymo</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kato Akhaia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32457.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 826" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 826</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32457.2" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Olenian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Achaian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ætolian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capra Olenie,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the goat of Amalthea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32457.3" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)wle/nios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Olenian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Achaian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ætolian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:113" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>the goat of Amalthea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tydeus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Calydon</tr>, <tr>in Ætolia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:402" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 402</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olens: <entryFree id="n32458" type="main" key="o^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from oleo.</entryFree>
olentia: <entryFree id="n32459" type="main" key="o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oleo</etym>, <sense id="n32459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olentica: <entryFree id="n32460" type="gloss" key="o^lenti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlentĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stinking places</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
olenticetum: <entryFree id="n32461" type="main" key="o^lenti^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlentĭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stinking place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dungheap</hi>, in trop. signif. (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olenticeta et fetutina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oleo: <entryFree id="n32462" type="main" key="o^le^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 2</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlo</orth>, ĕre; <sense id="n32462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> olat, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1</bibl>. 3, 121; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 5</bibl>). <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root od-; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/zw</foreign>; v. odor], <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi> (class.; cf. odoro, fragro). </sense><sense id="n32462.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To emit a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smell of</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n32462.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>acc.</case>, less freq. with <case>abl.</case> of that of which any thing smells: <cit><quote lang="la">quid (jura) olant, nescias, nisi id unum, male ut olere intellegas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:120 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 120 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: rosa recens a longinquo<pb n="1262" /> <cb n="OLEU" />  olet, sicca propius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olent, salsa sunt, ut tangere non velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres ideo bene olere, quia nihil olebant, videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesperis noctu magis olet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram crocum olere,</quote> <trans><tr>of wax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olet unguenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta exotica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina fere dulces oluerunt mane Camenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur nardo flammae non oluere meae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabo rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 405</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cui os oleat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has a foul breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32462.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to smell of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savor of</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to indicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi> any thing: quid igitur? quid olet? responde! <hi rend="ital">Pen.</hi> Furtum, scortum, prandium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil olere peregrinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to savor of</tr>, <tr>betray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex Academiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba alumnum olent,</quote> <trans><tr>betray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32462.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To betray itself</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be observed by its smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum huic olet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he smells out</tr>, <tr>observes that I have money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non olet, unde sit, quod dicitur cum illis?</quote> <trans><tr>don't you perceive whence it comes?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odorous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n32462.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sweet-smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odoriferous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami olentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpylla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olentia pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymettus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:622" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 622</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32462.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus (i. e. hircus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immundus olentia sudor Membra sequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medi ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna Palici, i. e. olentia sulphure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri (from dead bodies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:821" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 821</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32462.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <trans><tr>musty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32463" type="gloss" key="o^le^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype> <etym>root al-; Sanscr. ar-, to rise; cf.: indoles, almus, alumnus. etc.</etym>, <sense id="n32463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>, found only in the compounds: adoleo, aboleo, etc.</sense></entryFree>
oleomella: <entryFree id="n32464" type="main" key="o^le^o^mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕŏmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oleum-mel</etym>, <sense id="n32464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fruittree peculiar to Syria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oleoselinum: <entryFree id="n32465" type="main" key="o^le^o^se^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕŏsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>oleum-selinon</etym>, <sense id="n32465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling parsley</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oleosus: <entryFree id="n32466" type="main" key="o^le^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oleum</etym>, <sense id="n32466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of oil</hi> (Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 81, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">butyrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 35, § 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oleraceus: <entryFree id="n32467" type="main" key="o^le^ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕrācĕus</orth>, v. holeraceus, etc.</entryFree>
olesco: <entryFree id="n32468" type="gloss" key="o^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n32468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [2. oleo], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>: suboles ab olescendo, id est crescendo dictae, Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oleto: <entryFree id="n32469" type="gloss" key="o^le_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlēto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. oletum</etym>, <sense id="n32469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 97" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oletum: <entryFree id="n32470" type="main" key="o^le_tum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>olea</etym>, <sense id="n32470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with olive-trees; an olive-yard</hi> (ante-class. for the class. olivetum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32471" type="main" key="o^le_tum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>oleo</etym>, <sense id="n32471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrement</hi> (very rare): oletum, stercus humanum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=203" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 203</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">veto quisquam faxit oletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:112" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 112</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oleum: <entryFree id="n32472" type="greek" key="o^le^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n32472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olive-oil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 64 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lex. Thor. lin. 95 Rudorff. p. 191: instillare oleum lumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus Nudatos umeros oleo perfusa nitescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungere caules oleo meliore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 748</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">BALNEVM CVM OLEO GRATVITO DEDIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3738</bibl></cit>. —As a fig. of softness, gentleness: <cit><quote lang="la">oleo tranquillior,</quote> <trans><tr>quieter</tr>, <tr>gentler</tr>, <tr>stiller than oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 66</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum et operam perdere (alluding to nocturnal labors),</quote> <trans><tr>to lose one's time and trouble</tr>, <tr>to spend them in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne et opera et oleum philologiae nostrae perierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante lucem cum scriberem contra Epicureos, de eodem oleo et operā exaravi nescio quid ad te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit hic (labor) plus temporis atque olei plus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 99</bibl></cit>: oleum addere camino, <hi rend="ital">to add oil to the fire</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to aggravate an evil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 321</bibl> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/tth| kai\ e)lai/w| pu=r katasbennu/nai</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n32472.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32472.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The palœstra</hi> (from the use of oil to anoint the bodies of wrestlers): <cit><quote lang="la">ego eram decus olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32472.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">literary contests</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rhetorical exercises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus verborum nitidum, sed palaestrae magis et olei, quam hujus civilis turbae ac fori,</quote> <trans><tr>more proper for exercises in the school or for disputations</tr>, <tr>than for use in public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32472.5" n="C" level="2"> (In eccl. <cb n="OLIM" /> Lat.) <hi rend="ital">The spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unxit te Deus oleo exultationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 61, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olfacio: <entryFree id="n32473" type="main" key="olfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ēci, actum, 3</itype> (uncontracted collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĕfăcĭo</orth>: <sense id="n32473.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">olefacit, olefecit, olefactum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 167</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>oleo-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi> something (class.; syn. odoror). </sense><sense id="n32473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae gustemus, olfaciamus, tractemus, audiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus folia trita olfactaque,</quote> <trans><tr>smelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gith tusum, olfactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 183</bibl></cit> (olefactum, Jahn).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini sagacissime olfaciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have a very keen scent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32473.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">non sex totis mensibus olfecissem, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen poëtae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n32473.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to smell of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad matris mammam (agnus) non accedet, admovere oportet et olfacere labra lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olfactatrix: <entryFree id="n32474" type="main" key="olfacta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>olfacto</etym>, <sense id="n32474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who scents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">observes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 239</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olfacto: <entryFree id="n32475" type="main" key="olfacto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfacto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>olfacio</etym>, <sense id="n32475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smell at</hi> any thing (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana olfactata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 63, § 225</bibl></cit> (al. olefacta): <cit><quote lang="la">pulei ramum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves caelum olfactantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 88, § 364</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olfactoria: <entryFree id="n32476" type="hapax" key="olfacto_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>olfacto</etym>, <sense id="n32476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nosegay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bouquet</hi>, Fronto de Orat. p. 1 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
olfactoriolum: <entryFree id="n32477" type="main" key="olfacto_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactōrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>olfactorium</etym>, <sense id="n32477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little smelling-bottle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent-bottle</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">olfactoriola vascula sunt muliebria, in quibus odoramenta gestantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 3, 20</bibl>, et Hier. in loc.</sense></entryFree>
olfactorium: <entryFree id="n32478" type="main" key="olfacto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>olfacio</etym>, <sense id="n32478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nosegay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smelling-bottle</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 29, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 36, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olfactrix: <entryFree id="n32479" type="main" key="olfactrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. for olfactatrix (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 239</bibl>.</entryFree>
olfactus: <entryFree id="n32480" type="main" key="olfactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from olfacio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32481" type="main" key="olfactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>olfacio</etym>. <sense id="n32481.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smell</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">thymi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 156</bibl></cit> (al. olfacto thymo); 32, 3, 13, § 28; 35, 15, 51, § 182.—</sense><sense id="n32481.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sense of smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini nec olfactūs vestigia habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:194" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 70, 90, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olficus: <entryFree id="n32482" type="main" key="olfi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>olfacio</etym>, <sense id="n32482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smelling</hi>, in a play on the word Alphicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:96:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 96, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oliaros: <entryFree id="n32483" type="main" key="O_li^a^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlĭăros</orth>, <itype>for Olearos</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
olidus: <entryFree id="n32484" type="main" key="o^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oleo</etym>, <sense id="n32484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emitting a smell</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa picata bene olida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene olidae amphorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of a bad smell, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olida capra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesaepia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 157</bibl></cit>: senex, Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia olidissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oligochronius: <entryFree id="n32485" type="greek" key="o^li^gochro^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĭgochrŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)ligoxro/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n32485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting but a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortlived</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 3, 5.</sense></entryFree>
olim: <entryFree id="n32486" type="main" key="o_lim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōlim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ole, olle, ollus or olus, archaic for ille, with locative ending -im, = illo tempore, v. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 523</bibl></etym>, lit., <sense id="n32486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at that</hi> (sc. remote) <hi rend="ital">time;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n32486.1" n="I" level="1"> Of past time, <hi rend="ital">some time ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once upon a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whilom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erst</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. quondam): versibu' quos olim Fauni vatesque canebant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 222 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut fuit olim Sisyphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim olim loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim, vel nuper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 25, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. to hoc tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim...mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut erant olim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alium esse censes nunc me, atque olim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens olim armis, mox memoriā nominis clara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit olim senex: ei filiae Duae erant,</quote> <trans><tr>there was once an old man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32486.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32486.3" n="1" level="3"> From the meaning <hi rend="ital">in times past</hi> is derived that of <hi rend="ital">since ever</hi> (Germ. von jener), <hi rend="ital">what used to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the old custom;</hi> hence, in propositions which state, as the result cf experience, that any thing is wont to take place, <hi rend="ital">at times</hi> (only ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc lenonum plus est fere, Quam olim muscarum'st, cum caletur maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. id. <cb n="OLIV" /> Mil. 1, 1, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 143</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum tumidis submersum tunditur olim Fluctibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 391</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pueris olim dant crustula blandi Doctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut calceus olim, Si pede major erit, subvertet, si minor, uret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis olim si quis impiā manu Senile guttur fregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut olim Amisso dubiae rege vagantur apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:555" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color oris erat, qui frondibus olim Esse solet seris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 429</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quid est olim homini salute melius?</quote> <trans><tr>ever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra meos olim si fistula dicat amores,</quote> <trans><tr>if ever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32486.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Now for a long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this good while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long ago</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): olim non librum in manus sumpsi: olim nescio, quid sit otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audio quid veteres olim moneatis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:346" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas mihi epistulas mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptis moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olim jam nec perit quicquam mihi nec acquiritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32486.5" n="II" level="1"> Of the future, <hi rend="ital">one day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on a future day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a future time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereafter</hi> (rare but class.): audire edepol lubet. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Primum omnium olim terra quom proscinditur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam coram tecum olim, potius quam per epistulas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoriare aliquis ultor...Nunc, olim, quocumque dabunt se tempore vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 625</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non si male nunc et olim Sic erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsan et haec olim meminisse juvabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid ego illi Imprudens olim faciam simile?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir nominabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
